activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
With language in constant evolution, it is always good to find ways to make sure that there is no misunderstanding. For that you need different communication strategies. Suppose that you have given instructions to a fellow employee and you want to check that he or she has understood you. A common strategy is to ask: ‚ÄòDid you understand?‚Äô, but this is a poor strategy, because the social pressure to respond ‚ÄòYes, I did‚Äô is so high that we often do not get a true response to the question. A better way to check is to ask something like: ‚ÄòCan you explain that back to me?‚Äô or ‚ÄòSo now I‚Äôve explained, you show me what to do.‚Äô

Use open and closed questions when appropriate

Sometimes, when you are pushed for time and just want to confirm something, a simple closed question will suffice. For example, if you want to start a talk and are checking to see if the audience is ready, asking ‚ÄòAre you all ready to begin?‚Äô will elicit a simple yes/no answer. On the other hand, asking ‚ÄòHow do you feel about beginning?‚Äô gives audience members more of an option to delay, or to give rambling answers ‚Äì not good when you are pushed for time.

If, however, your goal is to get detailed information from someone, an open question trumps a closed one each time. Say you‚Äôve just delivered some important information and you want one of your colleagues to reinforce your message to the team ‚Äì asking ‚ÄòDave, can you explain to the group how you dealt with a similar problem last week?‚Äô will elicit a detailed response, whereas asking, ‚ÄòDave, would you agree?‚Äô lets your colleague off the hook with a simple yes/no answer.

Depersonalizing

Some listeners can be easily wrong-footed by too much use of the second person ‚Äòyou‚Äô. If you are concerned about members of your team arriving late for work, but you don‚Äôt want to single anyone out, it might be better to depersonalize the situation by saying: ‚ÄòRemember that we all need to be in the office by 8.30 every morning.‚Äô Choosing this strategy, instead of saying ‚ÄòYou all need to be in the office by 8.30 every morning‚Äô ensures that no one feels ‚Äòpicked on.‚Äô

Involving the audience

This sounds like a basic concept, but it‚Äôs one that most speakers forget, both when talking one-to-one and in large groups. Rambling on and on is a surefire way to encourage your audience to drift off and stop paying attention to what you are saying. Keep your audience focused on your message by maintaining eye contact. If you are addressing a room of people, look around the room regularly. Try to elicit nods or other gestures of understanding. If you don‚Äôt see any, it may be time to ask a comprehension question.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.

Dear Harry,

first of all we want to welcome you in our company. Also we hope you going to have a good start.
Motivating your team effectively is the key to strong leadership. That`s why I want you to know the following points to avoid because they will definitely demotivate your staff: Disrespect subordinates because they are below you.
 --> Take credit or claim responsibility for work done by your subordinates.
--> Lose your temper.
--> Let employees unfairly take the blame for things.
--> Don't compliment or praise people for good work.
To get the staff more motivated as it should be and makes it easier for our entire company, I want to give you some good tips to motivate the staff:
--> Incentivize your employees. Make them feel that the company's success means success for them as well. There's nothing like a possible reward to motivate people.
--> Take an active interest in your employees' career paths. Offer them additional training and act as their mentor.
--> Emphasize a healthy work-life balance. Recognize that employees have lives outside the company.
--> Listen to your employees. If people feel like they are being heard, even when they are complaining, they will be happier and more productive.
--> Treat subordinates the way you would like to be treated by your superiors.
If you have any questions or need support in any way, please dont hesitate to contact me at any time.

All the best,
Florian

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission: One of the most iconic legendary creatures in Indian mythology is the **NƒÅga**, a powerful serpent being revered across Hinduism, Buddhism, and Jainism. NƒÅgas are typically depicted as half-human and half-snake, often with a human torso and the lower body of a serpent. They are believed to dwell in the underworld (PƒÅtƒÅla) or near bodies of water like rivers, lakes, and oceans. In many stories, NƒÅgas are guardians of treasures, sacred knowledge, and powerful secrets. They are associated with fertility, rainfall, and the life-giving power of water. Though sometimes portrayed as dangerous or vengeful when provoked, NƒÅgas are generally considered wise and divine, and many are protectors of dharma. The serpent king Shesha, who serves as a bed for the god Vishnu, and Vasuki, who helped churn the ocean of milk, are two of the most famous NƒÅgas. Their presence in art, temple carvings, and folklore reflects their deep cultural significance in India, symbolizing both the mystery of nature and the balance between danger and protection.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Harry,
Here are some ideas for inspiring and empowering your team. Motivated employees are the backbone of a successful organization.
Start by incentivizing achievements‚Äîbonuses, recognition, or opportunities for growth can go a long way. When employees feel their contributions lead to tangible rewards, their motivation rises naturally.
Be genuinely invested in their professional development. Offer training programs, learning resources, and mentorship. Employees who see a clear path for advancement are more likely to stay engaged and loyal.
Promote a healthy work-life balance. When team members are well-rested and emotionally supported, their productivity and creativity flourish.
Make listening a habit. Open communication builds trust, and employees are more motivated when they know their voices matter.
Finally, lead by example. Respect, humility, and fairness set the tone for the team culture.
Avoid these pitfalls: disrespecting staff, taking credit for their work, losing your cool, scapegoating, and neglecting praise. These quickly erode trust and morale.
Wishing you the best,
EF Student

Why couldn't we get the best of the 2 options ?
The 3rd option could be to split our activities: keep a showroom in Centerville and move our manufacturing and back-office activities in south end or any other and convenient "cheap" district. Let's see this: we pay a costly $4500 for our place  but only 10% of it is used as a showroom. We might get a better showroom for , let's say $600 or $700, still in downtown Centerville and get a far bigger place in so called "industrial" district for something like $1500... There we can develop our factory, have a team for the web development and for creation of events, etc. etc. 
By splitting our activities and localizations, we can economize on the rents, still be in touch with our traditional customers and use the money we would hav espent in the actual (and future) rent to expand our activities and visibility online  as well as on real ephemeral spots.
What do you think of this 3rd option ?
Josh.

activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Hi Ken and Josh,

Thanks for the email, Ken! I really liked both of your ideas. The beach getaway sounds relaxing, and the mountain retreat would definitely be peaceful and full of nature. But I‚Äôd like to suggest a third option that I think combines the best of both ‚Äî a long weekend in Silverlake City!

Let me tell you why I think it‚Äôs the perfect spot for us.

Silverlake is located about halfway between both of you, which makes it a convenient meeting point. It's a mid-sized city with just under 500,000 people, so it‚Äôs lively without being overwhelming. It has a charming downtown with caf√©s, rooftop bars, bookstores, and plenty of live music ‚Äî I know how much Josh enjoys jazz, and we have some great venues here!

The big attraction, though, is the lake itself. Silverlake is known for its stunning freshwater lake with crystal-clear waters surrounded by rolling green hills. There‚Äôs a beautiful 10-mile trail around the lake, which is great for biking or hiking, and there‚Äôs a kayak rental place if we want to get out on the water.

The city also hosts the Summer Lights Festival the weekend of July 15‚Äì17, and it‚Äôs one of our biggest annual events. There are food trucks, local art shows, outdoor movies, and even a drone light show every evening over the lake. I think it‚Äôd be a fun atmosphere for us to hang out, catch up, and enjoy something a bit different.

Accommodation-wise, there are several cozy Airbnbs near the lakefront and even a boutique hotel called The Driftwood Lodge, which has great reviews. It‚Äôs affordable too ‚Äî around $120 per night per room. If we book soon, we might even be able to get a group discount.

Transportation shouldn‚Äôt be a problem either. Silverlake is serviced by a small regional airport (SLK), and if you‚Äôre driving, it‚Äôs just a 3.5-hour road trip from either of your cities. Once you‚Äôre here, everything is walkable or accessible by bike or scooter rentals.

I‚Äôve lived in Silverlake for about three years now, and every friend who visits ends up wanting to come back. The vibe is relaxed but not boring ‚Äî there‚Äôs always something happening, and people are super friendly. Plus, the food scene is incredible! We‚Äôve got everything from vegan bakeries to a new Korean barbecue place that‚Äôs been getting a lot of buzz.

If we plan it right, we could do a little bit of everything ‚Äî spend the mornings hiking or paddleboarding, the afternoons exploring downtown, and the evenings enjoying music and good food. And if the weather holds up (which it usually does this time of year ‚Äî sunny with highs in the mid-70s), it‚Äôll be a perfect mix of adventure and relaxation.

Let me know what you guys think. I‚Äôd be happy to take care of local arrangements ‚Äî booking a place, making reservations, or getting tickets to the festival. Just give me the green light, and I‚Äôll get things rolling!

Looking forward to hearing your thoughts.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
One of the most famous legendary creatures in Brazil is the Curupira. Deeply rooted in Brazilian folklore, the Curupira is a forest guardian known for its bright red hair and unique feature: its feet are turned backward. This unusual trait confuses hunters and intruders, as the footprints lead in the opposite direction, making it hard to track him.

According to legend, the Curupira protects the forest and its animals from those who try to harm them. He is often portrayed as a mischievous and unpredictable being who punishes those who hunt for pleasure or destroy nature unnecessarily. Sometimes, he uses illusions or sounds to drive people away from the forest.

This creature reflects the strong connection between Brazilian folklore and nature conservation. Stories of the Curupira are especially popular in the Amazon region, passed down through generations as a way to teach respect for the environment. Even today, the legend of the Curupira continues to fascinate children and adults alike.

activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
The Importance of Daily Exercise

Daily exercise plays a crucial role in maintaining both physical and mental health. Just 30 minutes of moderate activity each day can improve cardiovascular fitness, boost mood, and increase energy levels. Regular physical activity also helps control weight, strengthens muscles and bones, and reduces the risk of chronic diseases such as diabetes, heart disease, and certain cancers.

Exercise doesn't have to be intense or time-consuming. Walking, cycling, swimming, or even dancing are great ways to stay active. Consistency is more important than intensity, especially for beginners. Additionally, exercising outdoors can enhance the experience, offering fresh air and a change of scenery.

Beyond physical benefits, exercise is known to reduce stress, improve sleep quality, and boost self-esteem. It also promotes the release of endorphins, chemicals in the brain that act as natural painkillers and mood elevators. In short, making exercise a daily habit is a powerful step toward a healthier and happier life.

activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Subject: Urgent Decision Needed on Rent Increase and Future Plans

From: Ken
To: Josh

Hi Josh,

We really need to make a decision about the future of our business. Our landlord sent me another letter, and starting next month, the rent will increase by 25%, bringing it to $4,500 per month. That‚Äôs a significant jump and will cut even deeper into our profits‚Äî$54,000 annually!

To summarize where we stand, I know you‚Äôre leaning toward staying put and absorbing the higher rent. The main advantage of that is that we‚Äôre in a prime, fashionable district where we have a loyal customer base. The central location also allows us to attract busy professionals who can come by during lunch to get measured for suits and other high-end clothing. However, the downside is that our clothing sales are growing slower than our rising expenses, and with the rapid growth in Centerville, we can expect further rent hikes in the future.

On the other hand, I‚Äôm still in favor of transitioning to a different model. I propose relocating our manufacturing to the south end of town, but creating a system where we meet customers in their offices or schools for measurements. We could also build a much better website, showcasing our clothing options and allowing customers to submit their measurements online. This would offer significant cost savings. The downside, of course, is that we'd lose our showroom‚Äîcustomers wouldn‚Äôt be able to come in to browse, touch fabrics, and experience the personalized service that has helped us build strong relationships with them.

I‚Äôve been thinking about other alternatives, but honestly, I‚Äôm running out of ideas. Do you think we should talk to more people about our options? I‚Äôm open to anything, but we do need to make a decision soon.

Thanks,
Ken

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
Learning a new language is a rewarding but challenging journey that requires dedication and persistence. One of the most common difficulties language students face is pronunciation. Many languages have sounds that do not exist in a student‚Äôs native tongue, making it difficult to replicate them accurately.

Another major challenge is memorizing vocabulary. Words and phrases can be difficult to retain, especially when they are unrelated to a student‚Äôs daily life. Using techniques like repetition, flashcards, and association with familiar concepts can help improve retention.

Grammar rules also pose a challenge, as they often differ significantly between languages. Some languages use complex structures, irregular verbs, or different sentence patterns, making it hard for learners to internalize them. Practice and exposure to native speakers can help develop an intuitive understanding of grammar.

Additionally, many students struggle with confidence when speaking. Fear of making mistakes can prevent learners from practicing, slowing progress. Overcoming this requires a positive mindset and a willingness to take risks.

Lastly, immersion plays a crucial role. Without frequent exposure to a language, progress can be slow. Watching movies, reading books, and conversing with fluent speakers can accelerate learning.

About Tia, I‚Äôm really sorry it‚Äôs not going well. Relationships can be confusing and emotional. If you think it‚Äôs ending, give yourself time to feel sad. That‚Äôs normal. Talk to someone, or write your thoughts down to let it out. Don‚Äôt rush into anything new, focus on yourself for now.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Harry,
Here are some ideas for motivating your team. I‚Äôve also included a few things to avoid.
Start by giving your team clear reasons to care about their work. If they feel that the company‚Äôs success is their success too, they will be more engaged. Encourage their professional growth by offering training opportunities and acting as a mentor.
Support a healthy work-life balance. People do their best work when they feel rested and valued outside of work. Also, make time to listen to your team. Even when they‚Äôre raising concerns.
Treat your team with the same respect you want from your own manager.
Here are some things to avoid:
‚Äì Don‚Äôt disrespect team members because of their position.
‚Äì Don‚Äôt take credit for others‚Äô work.
‚Äì Stay calm, even in stressful situations.
‚Äì Don‚Äôt blame others unfairly.
‚Äì Recognize good work with praise.
Best of luck with your new team.
Federico

activity_instructions: Read the blog about a law in Japan, then write about a law in your country. Type in the input box. Write 60-90 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission: One interesting law in India is that flying a kite is legally considered flying an aircraft under the Aircraft Act of 1934. This means you technically need permission to fly a kite, especially in public spaces. While this law is rarely enforced, it still exists and surprises many people. It was originally created to ensure safety in airspace, but today it seems outdated. Still, it‚Äôs a reminder of how old laws can remain part of modern legal systems.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Harry,

Motivating a team is really about creating the kind of environment where people feel valued, heard, and part of something meaningful.
Start by listening ‚Äî really listening. When people feel their voices matter, they‚Äôre more likely to bring their best selves to work. Don‚Äôt underestimate the power of small, genuine recognition. A quick ‚Äúthank you‚Äù or ‚Äúgreat job‚Äù can go a long way.
Support your team‚Äôs growth. Take time to understand their goals and offer opportunities to learn or take on new challenges. It shows you care not just about the work they do, but about who they‚Äôre becoming.
Also, encourage balance. When people feel supported in managing their lives outside of work, they tend to be more focused and energized on the job.
On the flip side, try to avoid micromanaging ‚Äî trust is key. And while bonuses and perks are nice, don‚Äôt rely on them too much. Authentic appreciation often motivates more deeply than money alone.
At the end of the day, leadership is about relationships. Be present, be fair, and lead with empathy ‚Äî your team will notice, and they‚Äôll respond.

All the best,
Anne

activity_instructions: Your boss has asked you to write a formal report recommending a training company. You've chosen Skills Pro. Use your notes to write up the report. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
After comparing two training providers, TrainQuick and Skills Pro, I recommend that we proceed with Skills Pro for our employee training needs.

Although TrainQuick offers cheaper and more flexible options, it has several drawbacks. Employees have reported discomfort when mixed with staff from other branches during sessions, and the program has seen low usage in other locations. These factors may impact overall engagement and learning outcomes.

On the other hand, Skills Pro, while more expensive, has demonstrated higher quality in both course content and results. Although some participants initially find the content challenging, most complete the course successfully. Furthermore, Skills Pro is planning to expand its course offerings, which could provide additional value to our company in the future.

Considering the importance of effective training and long-term results, Skills Pro is the best choice. Its high completion rate and potential for future development outweigh the higher cost.

Recommendation: Approve partnership with Skills

activity_instructions: Your colleague is proposing a new location for your office. Read his email, then write the executive summary telling which one he recommends, Office One or Office Bravo. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
The shoe company ‚ÄúStep Forward‚Äù is currently facing a challenging business situation. Over the past six months, sales have declined due to increased competition from online retailers offering cheaper products. Additionally, the rising cost of raw materials has impacted the company‚Äôs profit margins.

To respond to this situation, the management team organized an emergency meeting to analyze the current market trends and customer feedback. They discovered that customers are looking for more sustainable and comfortable footwear options. As a result, the company decided to launch a new eco-friendly product line using recycled materials and innovative designs.

Furthermore, the marketing team developed a digital campaign focused on promoting the brand‚Äôs values of quality, comfort, and sustainability. The company is also investing in improving its e-commerce platform to reach a wider audience and provide a better online shopping experience.

The goal is to recover market share, strengthen customer loyalty, and position the brand as a leader in sustainable footwear  within the next year.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Harry,

Welcome aboard! Here are some practical tips to help you effectively motivate your team, along with a few common pitfalls to avoid. 

First, incentivize your employees to connect their performance to meaningful rewards. when people feel that their efforts contribute directly to their success, they're far more motivated.
Second, support their career development by offering training opportunities and acting as a mentor. This shows genuine investment in their growth.
Also, promote a healthy work-life balance. When employees feel trusted and respected outside of work, they bring more energy and focus to their jobs.
Above all, listen actively. Giving your team a voice fosters trust and engagement.
And finally, treat others as you'd want to be treated-with fairness, dignity and respect.
Avoid these demotivating behaviors:
- Disrespecting team members because of their position.
- Taking credit for others work.
- Losing your temper.

Creating a positive culture takes efforts, but the results are worth it. Wishing you great success in your new role!

Best Regards,
Aarohi

activity_instructions: An old friend has emailed you, describing what he's been doing for the last decade. Pretend you have two kids living abroad, and write a response describing what they have been doing. Type in the input box. Write 50-100 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
Hey! I got your email address from our old friend, Valerie. I can't believe that we've only seen each other once in the last 20 years! A lot has happened in my life since then.

About five years ago, Stella and I moved with our son Jeremy to Oxford, New Zealand, and lived out in the country. I did contract design work. You know that's what I've always loved. Stella taught math in a local university. Jeremy went to school and made a lot of friends. Eventually, though, we ended up back in St. Louis, where we've been living for the past year.

I'm working for a design firm, and Stella has been teaching in a university. We bought a little two-bedroom house in the suburbs, and we're basically happy, but sometimes we feel that something's missing. The suburbs are crowded, and the houses all look the same. Jeremy left for college, so we're lonely, old empty nesters looking for a change. We're actually thinking about adopting a child. At our age, are we crazy?

Anyway, let's reconnect. Your kids must be all grown up now. How are they doing? Please send photos!

Cheers!

Stan

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission: In my opinion, social responsibility is a fundamental objective for companies because they have a big impact on society. In fact, even if companies pursue the higher earning possibile they don't have to forget the importance of sustainability for our community, which could be put into practice by starting from fair conditions for the employees and going on with operations which respct high social standards. Therefore, I surely agree with the quotes in favour of CSR. In particular, I would like to mention the following sentence posted by Jack@MSU: "Companies with a good CSR record are rewarded by customer loyalty". This is totally true! Consumers notice and appreciate companies with a good CSR record and are more pleasant to buy items or services from them. On the other hand, as I said before we also have to take into consideration that the real objective of business is to increase its business. Therefore, corporations would probably invest just a little sum of its earning on social projects. Also, this fact could lead corporations to sponsor CSR just in order to appear "a great company" in front of the society. Nevertheless, this issue would risk to discourage the development and spreading of CSR between the companies, with negative consequences for all world benefits. On the contrary, it is necessary to take one step at a time and to appreciate what nowadays companies are doing to improve their CSR. Hopefully, in the future such an importance to respect social expectations will be regulated by law and implemented by all companies.

student_submission: I recently negotiated the price of a laptop I was looking to buy. The preliminary offer from the seller was $800, which felt too high for a used device. This negotiation felt like a win-win situation because I was able to save some money, and the seller was satisfied with the deal. In the end, both of us walked away happy.

activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
**Subject: A Third Option for Consideration**

Hi Josh and Ken,

I‚Äôve been thinking about our situation and came up with a third possibility. What if we move to a more affordable location, but stay close enough to downtown to maintain customer access while avoiding the dramatic rent hikes? There‚Äôs an emerging area on the east side of Centerville that‚Äôs attracting a lot of professionals and families. It‚Äôs a bit quieter, but it‚Äôs starting to show signs of gentrification with a steady increase in foot traffic, and the rent is much lower‚Äîaround \$3,200 per month. This would save us \$1,300 a month, or \$15,600 annually, without sacrificing visibility.

We could set up a smaller showroom for a more personalized experience, but also implement an appointment system where customers book fittings, making it more efficient. With the extra savings, we could invest in a better online presence and even offer virtual fittings, where customers upload photos and measurements. The best part is, the area is close enough to downtown to not lose our loyal clientele, and we‚Äôd still have room to grow.

Let‚Äôs discuss this in more detail. It might be a good middle ground!

Best,
Vinicius

activity_instructions: Read an email from your friend and give advice on some stressful problems he is having. Type in the input box. Write 100-200 words.
student_submission:
Hi Leon, 

I am so sorry to hear it - you seem to be going through a lot. 

There are certain things that are beyond our control, but there are many that we can work towards to make it better. For your work, try to have a candid conversation with your manager and tell her very clearly about how you feel. I think it would also do good if you can share some constructive and actionable feedback that they might work on. At the same time, try to listen to them with an open mind. Sometimes, we make our decisions too quickly. 

About your relationship with Tia, i would like to hear more from you. Is it the stress at work that's adding to the problem? or is there something else? 

Sometime, it helps to take a deep breath and calm down. Give yourself the time. Ask yourself what's really going on. 

And I am alway there if you want to talk more.

activity_instructions: You're going to reply to Alice's blog post about cross-cultural communication. Give advice about your own culture. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
I work for a global company. I've been lucky enough to travel around the world and do business with many different people in many different countries. What I've learned is that understanding cross-cultural differences is critical for successful communication.
For example, people from my culture are apt to maintain eye contact in a conversation. In some countries I've visited, however, maintaining eye contact can be considered rather rude or even aggressive. I also have a way of gesturing a lot ‚Äì you know, like moving my hands and pointing.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Indian mythology is rich with legendary creatures, including the bird-like Garuda, the serpent-like Naga, and the demon-like Rakshasa. Other prominent creatures include the Navagunjara, a composite animal, and the Yali, a lion-elephant hybrid. 
Here's a more detailed look at some key legendary creatures in Indian mythology:
Garuda:
A majestic bird-like creature, often depicted as the mount of Lord Vishnu, and a symbol of strength and power. 
Naga:
Serpent-like beings associated with water, fertility, and sometimes depicted as guardians of treasures. 
Rakshasa:
Demon-like beings, often depicted as sorcerers with shapeshifting abilities, capable of causing harm. 
Navagunjara:
A composite creature made of nine different animals, often depicted as a form of Vishnu or Krishna. 
Yali:
A hybrid creature with the head of a lion, the trunk and tusks of an elephant, and sometimes equine features. Yalis are often depicted as guardians at temple entrances. 
Sharabha:
A fierce creature, a combination of a lion and a bird, known for its strength and speed. 
Makara:
A sea creature, often depicted with the head and body of a crocodile, fish scales, and sometimes elephant tusks. Makara is associated with the zodiac sign Capricorn and is often seen as a guardian. 
Airavata:
A white elephant, the mount of the god Indra, and a symbol of royalty and power. 
Nandi:
The bull mount of Lord Shiva, a symbol of strength, devotion, and protection. 
Gandaberunda:
A mythical bird, a symbol of strength and the triumph of good over evil. 
Ahi/Vritra:
A huge serpent, a major adversary of the gods in Indian mythology. 
Timingila:
A gigantic sea serpent. 
These are just a few examples of the many fascinating and powerful legendary creatures that populate Indian mythology.

activity_instructions: Your boss has asked you to write a formal report recommending a training company. You've chosen Skills Pro. Use your notes to write up the report. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Training Provider Recommendation Report

After reviewed two training companies, TrainQuick and Skills Pro, I recommend proceeding with Skills Pro for our employee development needs.

While TrainQuick offers lower costs and flexible options, we have received feedback indicating that its usage is limited across our branches. Employees have also expressed dissatisfaction with being mixed with participants from other branches, which impacts the effectiveness of the training.

In contrast, although more expensive, Skills Pro provides high-quality training. Although the course content is challenging, participants who complete the programme report positive outcomes and a strong sense of accomplishment. Skills Pro is also planning to expand its course offerings, which could benefit our team in the long term.

Given the higher quality and success rates reported by participants, I believe that Skills Pro's slightly higher cost is justified. Investing in quality training will lead to a more skilled workforce and greater long-term benefits. Therefore, I recommend choosing Skills Pro as our training provider.

activity_instructions: Read an email from your friend and give advice on some stressful problems he is having. Type in the input box. Write 100-200 words.
student_submission: Hi Marcela, I hope you are doing well! I am going through a difficult time and needed to vent. Work is very stressful, with tight deadlines and a lot of pressure. Plus, I am feeling a bit distant from my friends and it is making me sad. What do you think I could do? Sometimes I feel like I can't handle it all. Thanks for listening! Hugs, Judith. ----------------------------------Hi Judith! I am glad you shared this with me. First of all, remember that it is normal to feel overwhelmed sometimes. For work stress, try to organize your tasks into a list and prioritize what really needs to be done first. This can help make things more manageable. As for the distance from friends, how about scheduling a coffee or a video call? Sometimes, a light conversation can do wonders. Don't hesitate to ask for support when you need it; your friends will be there for you! Take care of yourself and don't forget to take some time to relax! Best regards, Marcela.

Walk of fame

Since 1960, the Hollywood Boulevard Avenue attracts visitors to see star-plaques with the names of celebrities: actors, singers, movie directors, stage performers or anyone who has contributed to make Hollywood known worldwide. Each pink star is made of a marble called terrazzo, a bronze shield with the honoree‚Äôs name and an icon of the celebrity job, like a camera, television or a microphone, for example.

Whether you're working toward academic goals, improving your health, or building a skill, small actions repeated daily can lead to major results over time. activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
A creature that is famous in my country, Argentina, is called "El Pombero" which doesn't have a direct translation to English. It's a kind of goblin or forest spirit that roams in our countryside and protects the animals and the nature against human harm. 
El Pombero does not show his face, almost always has a straw hat and black clothes. It's said that he has the ability to shapeshift into birds or objects in order to watch over the people that adventure into his lands. He often lets the intruder know that is being followed or observed by whistling.
But most people have nothing to fear, even less if they left some offerings to him, like honey or tobacco. The ones that should be afraid are the men that take from the nature more than they will consume. When this happens, he gets angry will use his shapeshift ability to confuse these men and make them intrude even more in the wild, where they never come back.
In conclusion, El Pombero in one of the more popular tales that are shared here in Argentina that makes people behave better when they visit our beautiful countryside.

activity_instructions: Your boss has asked you to write a formal report recommending a training company. You've chosen Skills Pro. Use your notes to write up the report. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
After evaluating two training companies, TrainQuick and Skills Pro, we have gathered some insights that will help us make an informed decision.

TrainQuick offers a cost-effective and flexible training solution. However, it has not been well-received in our other branch. Employees have expressed discomfort with being mixed with participants from other branches during their classes, which has led to low utilization rates.

On the other hand, Skills Pro is a more expensive option, but it comes with several advantages. Although the course content is described as challenging, it has a high success rate among participants. Those who complete the course often do so successfully, indicating that the training is effective and thorough. Additionally, Skills Pro has plans to expand their course offerings, which could provide even more value in the future.

Given these considerations, it seems prudent to opt for Skills Pro despite the higher cost. The quality of training is paramount, and investing in a program that ensures successful outcomes for our employees will likely yield better long-term benefits. Quality training can enhance employee skills, boost morale, and ultimately contribute to the overall success of our organization. Therefore, Skills Pro appears to be the better choice for our training needs.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Hi Harry, 
I hope everything it¬¥s going well.

Congratulations for joining your new company, I know it may be hard to enter a new place and manage the teams and people at the beginning.

So, here are 3 ideas and strategies that you can put into practice to motivate effectively your team:

Be a leader, not a boss. Today¬¥s generations look for guidance from the people we report. 

Empathize and listen to your employees when unexpected situations occur.

Give feedback to your employees so they know where they need to improve.

Avoid these points so that they don¬¥t get demotivated:
Let your emotions interfere with your work.
Call their attention without explaining what they did wrong
Don¬¥t recognize their effort in different situations. 

I hope these tips and key points helps you to manage better your employees. 

Good luck with your new position, I remain attentive in case you require something else. 
Alessandra.

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission: Learning a new language is an exciting journey, but it is also full of challenges. What are the most common difficulties that students face in this process? One of the main obstacles is a lack of confidence when speaking. Many students are afraid of making mistakes and, as a result, avoid communicating. How can we overcome this fear and create a more welcoming environment for practice? One solution could be group practice, where students feel more comfortable expressing themselves. Another challenge is the variety of vocabulary and grammar. How can we make learning more effective and less overwhelming? Using interactive apps and games can help to retain the content in a fun way. In addition, watching films or listening to music in the target language can enrich vocabulary in a natural way. Finally, motivation is crucial to maintaining interest over time. What strategies can we use to stay motivated? Setting realistic goals and celebrating small achievements can be a great way to stay focused. So while learning a new language can be challenging, with the right approaches and a supportive environment, it is possible to turn this journey into a rewarding and enriching experience.

activity_instructions: Write about a movie you recently saw. Give facts and opinions about it. Who starred in the movie? Who directed it? What was it about? Type in the input box. Write 60-100 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
Sure! Here's a write-up about a recent movie: "Dune: Part Two" (2024)


---

Title: Dune: Part Two
Director: Denis Villeneuve
Starring:

Timoth√©e Chalamet as Paul Atreides

Zendaya as Chani

Rebecca Ferguson as Lady Jessica

Austin Butler as Feyd-Rautha

Florence Pugh as Princess Irulan

Javier Bardem as Stilgar

Stellan Skarsg√•rd as Baron Harkonnen



---

Plot Summary (Facts):
Dune: Part Two picks up right where the first film left off. Paul Atreides has joined the Fremen after House Atreides is betrayed and overthrown by House Harkonnen. The movie follows his rise as a messianic figure among the Fremen, his growing relationship with Chani, and his eventual confrontation with the forces of the corrupt Emperor and Baron Harkonnen. It's a continuation of the adaptation of Frank Herbert‚Äôs classic 1965 sci-fi novel Dune.


---

Direction & Cinematography (Opinion):
Denis Villeneuve delivers a visually stunning film with breathtaking desert landscapes and epic battle sequences. The pacing is faster and more intense than the first part, which some viewers may find more engaging. Villeneuve‚Äôs signature style‚Äîgrand scale and emotional restraint‚Äîworks especially well in this darker, more political second half.


---

Acting (Opinion):
Timoth√©e Chalamet gives a more commanding and complex performance in this film compared to Part One. Zendaya, who had limited screen time before, plays a much larger and emotionally resonant role as Chani. Austin Butler is a scene-stealer as the twisted and menacing Feyd-Rautha. The supporting cast, including Florence Pugh and Javier Bardem, adds depth and intrigue.


---

Themes (Facts and Opinion):
The film explores themes of prophecy, power, colonialism, and destiny. What makes Dune: Part Two compelling is how it complicates the idea of a ‚Äúchosen one‚Äù and challenges the morality of heroism. It‚Äôs not just about good vs. evil‚Äîit‚Äôs about the dangers of believing too deeply in myths.


---

Final Verdict (Opinion):
Dune: Part Two is a bold, thought-provoking, and visually arresting sequel that not only lives up to the hype but elevates the series. It‚Äôs a must-watch for fans of science fiction, even if you're not deeply familiar with the book.


---

Let me know if you want a spoiler-free version or a comparison to the novel!

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Motivating your team is essential for creating a positive, productive, and engaging work environment. When your team feels motivated, they are more likely to perform at their best, stay committed, and contribute to the overall success of your organization. Here are some friendly and practical tips to help you motivate your team effectively:

Encourage Open Communication
Create an environment where team members feel comfortable sharing their ideas, concerns, and feedback. Listen actively and show genuine interest in what they have to say. This builds trust and makes them feel valued.

Recognize and Celebrate Achievements
Acknowledge individual and team accomplishments regularly. Simple gestures like saying ‚Äúgood job‚Äù or giving small rewards can boost morale and motivate everyone to keep striving for excellence.

Set Clear Goals and Expectations
Help your team understand what is expected of them. Clear goals give direction and purpose, making it easier for team members to stay focused and motivated.

Provide Opportunities for Growth
Offer training, workshops, or new responsibilities that allow team members to develop their skills. When people see opportunities for personal and professional growth, they tend to be more engaged.

Foster a Positive Work Environment
Create a space where positivity, respect, and collaboration thrive. Encourage teamwork and support among colleagues. A friendly atmosphere makes work more enjoyable.

Offer Autonomy and Trust
Allow team members to take ownership of their tasks. Trusting them to make decisions shows confidence in their abilities and motivates them to perform well.

Be Supportive and Approachable
Show empathy and be available to help when needed. When team members know they can rely on you, they feel more secure and motivated.

Provide Constructive Feedback
Offer feedback that is specific, helpful, and encouraging. Focus on solutions and improvements rather than just pointing out mistakes.

Create a Sense of Purpose
Help your team see how their work contributes to larger goals or the company's mission. Feeling that their work makes a difference can be highly motivating.

Encourage Work-Life Balance
Respect personal time and promote a healthy balance between work and personal life. Happy, rested employees are more productive and motivated.

Maintain Fairness and Transparency
Be honest and fair in your dealings. Transparency about decisions and processes builds trust and loyalty.

Lead by Example
Demonstrate enthusiasm, dedication, and a positive attitude. Your behavior sets the tone for the team.

Create Opportunities for Social Interaction
Organize team-building activities or informal gatherings. Building strong relationships fosters a sense of belonging and motivation.

Set Realistic and Achievable Goals
Avoid setting unattainable targets. Achievable goals help maintain motivation and prevent frustration.

Encourage Innovation and Creativity
Allow team members to suggest new ideas and approaches. Feeling that their input matters motivates them to be more engaged.

Provide Adequate Resources and Support
Ensure your team has the tools and support needed to do their jobs effectively. Frustration from lack of resources can diminish motivation.

Celebrate Milestones and Successes
Mark important achievements with celebrations or acknowledgments. Recognizing progress keeps momentum going.

Be Patient and Understanding
Everyone has good days and bad days. Show patience and understanding, especially during challenging times.

Maintain a Friendly and Respectful Attitude
Treat everyone with kindness and respect. A friendly environment encourages motivation and loyalty.

Avoid Negative Behaviors
Refrain from disrespect, blaming others, or losing your temper. Negative attitudes can demotivate and create a toxic environment.

Encourage Collaboration
Promote teamwork and collective problem-solving. Working together can inspire new.

Do you believe companies have a responsibility to society? Or do you think a company's only responsibility is to its shareholders? We invite you to join this discussion by posting your opinion on corporate social responsibility (CSR). Below are some quotes from recent submissions. We look forward to hearing from you!
For CSR

Companies have a big impact on society. They should help the communities where they operate. After all, those communities are letting them do business there. It's a two-way street. And it's the same with sustainable operations and fair employee benefits. The former secures future possibilities, and the latter ensures high productivity and low turnover.
‚Äì lil@213

The reason CSR makes good business sense, the reason it contributes to the bottom line, is because consumers care. Companies with a good CSR record are rewarded by customer loyalty. Consumers are happy, the company performs well and communities around the world benefit.
‚Äì Jack@MSU

As an integrated part of society, corporations need to conform to social expectations, and that entails helping the community.
‚Äì James.W@efstudent.com

Against CSR

The problem with corporate social responsibility is that corporations don't have social responsibility. Milton Friedman has pointed out that the real responsibility of business is to increase its profits; business is not answerable to society's expectations but to the shareholders'.
‚Äì theG8T

It's great that corporations are spending huge sums of money on development projects across the world, but these sums of money are usually still inconsiderable relative to total earnings. In this sense, it's still quite a cheap marketing device to buy a good public image.
‚Äì JackD_92

It's the government's job to make and enforce laws and regulations that will benefit the greater public. Corporations will need to conform to these regulations, but by no means should they be put in the driver's seat.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
The Naga

In Indian mythology, Nagas are serpent-like beings that hold significant cultural and religious importance. They are often depicted as half-human, half-snake creatures, possessing immense power and wisdom. Nagas are believed to reside in the underworld, known as Patala, and are guardians of treasures and sacred places.

Nagas can be both benevolent and malevolent. They are revered in Hinduism, Buddhism, and Jainism, often associated with water bodies like rivers, lakes, and seas. In Hindu mythology, the Naga king Vasuki is known for his role in the churning of the ocean, where he served as the rope wrapped around Mount Mandara. Another famous Naga is Shesha, the multi-headed serpent who serves as the bed for Lord Vishnu.

Nagas are also linked to fertility and prosperity, and many temples in India have shrines dedicated to them. They are celebrated during festivals like Nag Panchami, where devotees offer milk and prayers to appease these powerful beings. The lore of Nagas is rich and varied, making them one of the most intriguing legendary creatures in Indian mythology.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
One legendary creature I find fascinating is the Chupacabra, a mythical beast that originated in Latin American folklore but has captured imaginations around the world. The name ‚ÄúChupacabra‚Äù literally means ‚Äúgoat sucker‚Äù in Spanish, referring to its alleged habit of attacking livestock, especially goats, and drinking their blood.

Descriptions of the Chupacabra vary, but it's often portrayed as a reptilian creature with greenish-gray, scaly skin, sharp spines down its back, and glowing red eyes. Some accounts describe it as more canine in appearance, like a hairless wild dog. It is said to be around 3 to 4 feet tall and moves either by hopping or on all fours.

The first reported sightings occurred in Puerto Rico in the 1990s, but since then, tales of the Chupacabra have spread across the Americas. Despite investigations and supposed sightings, no scientific evidence supports its existence. Still, the creature remains a popular subject in books, documentaries, and urban legends.

What makes the Chupacabra so intriguing is how it reflects rural fears of mysterious predators and the unknown. Whether real or not, it continues to be a powerful symbol of mystery, survival, and cultural storytelling.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
The Wolpertinger: Bavaria's Peculiar Beast

Deep in the alpine forests of Bavaria lurks one of Germany's most whimsical legendary creatures: the Wolpertinger. 

This bizarre beast appears as a patchwork of various animals, typically sporting the body of a rabbit or squirrel, the antlers of a deer, the wings of a pheasant, and sometimes the fangs of a vampire or the webbed feet of a duck. No two Wolpertingers are exactly alike, as if nature cobbled them together from spare parts.

According to Bavarian folklore, these elusive creatures inhabit the remote mountainous regions around the Alps, emerging only during full moons to forage for food. Local hunters claim that Wolpertingers can only be caught by beautiful young women, as the creatures become mesmerized by feminine beauty and lose their natural wariness.

The legend likely originated as a playful hoax by Bavarian taxidermists in the 19th century, who would create bizarre mounted specimens by combining parts from different animals. Today, these curious creatures remain popular tourist attractions in Bavaria, with many inns and restaurants displaying supposed Wolpertinger specimens, keeping this charming piece of German folklore alive.

activity_instructions: You're going to reply to Alice's blog post about cross-cultural communication. Give advice about your own culture. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible.

I work for a global company. I've been lucky enough to travel around the world and do business with many different people in many different countries. What I've learned is that understanding cross-cultural differences is critical for successful communication.

For example, people from my culture are apt to maintain eye contact in a conversation. In some countries I've visited, however, maintaining eye contact can be considered rather rude or even aggressive. I also have a way of gesturing a lot ‚Äì you know, like moving my hands and pointing. In one country, I learned that pointing with a finger is somewhat impolite. Oh, yeah ‚Äì and I have a tendency to talk a lot and be quite direct. I also tend to be a little uncomfortable with silence. There are a lot of countries where just the opposite is true.

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
Learning a new language is an exciting journey, but it also presents several challenges. Why do students struggle to stay motivated? One common issue is lack of immediate progress‚Äîmany learners expect quick results and become discouraged when fluency takes longer than anticipated. How can they stay motivated despite setbacks?

Another challenge is pronnunciation and listening comprehension. New sounds can be difficult to reproduce, and understanding native speakers‚Äîespecially when they speak quickly‚Äîcan feel overwhelming. What techniques can help with this? Listening to music, watching TV shows, and practicing with native speakers can make a big difference.

Students also often face grammar complexity. Rules may differ from those in their native language, leading to confusion and errors. Instead of memorizing rules, learners can benefit from using the language in real-life situations.A final obstacle is fear of making mistakes. Many learners hesitate to speak for fear of embarrassment. But isn‚Äôt making mistakes part of learning? Creating a safe, supportive environment helps students build confidence and fluency over time.

By identifying these challenges and exploring effective strategies to overcome them, language learners can feel more empowered and enjoy the journey‚Äîeven when it gets tough.

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
Language learning is an exciting but often challenging journey. Students face several common obstacles that can slow their progress or even discourage them. One major challenge is *lack of confidence*. Many learners fear making mistakes, which prevents them from practicing speaking and writing. However, mistakes are a natural part of learning and should be embraced as opportunities to improve.

Another difficulty is *limited exposure to the target language*. Students who do not regularly listen to native speakers or engage in conversations struggle to develop fluency. Immersion‚Äîthrough music, movies, and conversations‚Äîcan help reinforce vocabulary and pronunciation.

Grammar complexity can also be intimidating. Many languages have intricate rules that learners find confusing. Instead of memorizing endless rules, students can benefit from understanding patterns and practicing in real-life situations.

Finally, *motivation and consistency* are crucial. Learning a language requires patience, and it is easy to lose motivation if progress feels slow. Setting achievable goals, using engaging resources, and celebrating small victories can keep students motivated.

ToAll
Hi, there.

I have a problem I'd like your help with. I know what a creative writer you are. Could you take a look at the text below and rewrite it for me to make it more interesting? Here's the text:

Dear colleague,

This is to inform you of an upcoming change in company policy. Starting on the first Monday of next month, the company will be providing free breakfasts to all employees. We hope this will be a way to lessen the stress of trying to grab something to eat before getting to work, and also give us all a chance to socialize a bit before we start our day.

We're very pleased with our menu. We will be offering fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, bagels and doughnuts every day. In addition, we will have one hot item each day. This could be anything from scrambled eggs and potatoes to pancakes with maple syrup. We will also be offering fresh-brewed coffees and teas, along with fresh-squeezed orange and grapefruit juices.

I'd like everyone to be as excited as I am, and I'm hoping that, with your help and creativity, this new policy will be a big success.

Thanks for your help.

Mary

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Harry,

Here are some strategies to effectively motivate your team, along with pitfalls to avoid.

Motivation Strategies:

Incentivize Performance: Align individual goals with company success. Consider offering rewards or recognition for achievements to foster a sense of ownership.

Support Career Development: Take an interest in your team‚Äôs growth. Provide opportunities for training and mentorship, which can boost morale and engagement.

Promote Work-Life Balance: Acknowledge that employees have lives outside of work. Encouraging flexibility can lead to increased job satisfaction.

Encourage Open Communication: Make it a priority to listen to your team. When employees feel heard, they are more likely to be engaged and productive.

Model Respect: Treat your team with the same respect you wish to receive. Building a culture of mutual respect fosters loyalty.

Pitfalls to Avoid:

Disrespecting Team Members: Never belittle or dismiss their contributions.

Taking Credit for Others‚Äô Work: Always acknowledge your team‚Äôs efforts.

Losing Your Temper: Maintain composure, as it sets the tone for the workplace.

Unfair Blame: Ensure accountability is shared fairly.

Withholding Praise: Regularly recognize and celebrate achievements to boost morale.

Good luck leading your team!

Best,
Eduardo Anjos

Subject: Alternative Proposal for Our Business Location

Dear Ken and Josh,

I hope this email finds you well. After considering our current situation and the options we've discussed, I would like to propose a third alternative that might offer a balanced solution.

How about relocating to the newly developed Riverside Business Park? This area is rapidly becoming a hub for boutique businesses and offers a blend of affordability and visibility. The rent is significantly lower than our current location, at approximately $3,000 per month, which would save us $18,000 annually. This area is also attracting a lot of foot traffic due to its scenic riverside views and the recent opening of several popular cafes and restaurants.

By moving to Riverside, we can maintain a physical showroom where customers can experience our products firsthand. Additionally, we can leverage the growing popularity of the area to attract new clients. We can also enhance our online presence to complement the physical store, allowing customers to browse and order online while still offering personalized service through in-store consultations.

This option provides a middle ground, balancing cost savings with the need to maintain a strong customer relationship.

Looking forward to your thoughts.

Best regards,

[Your Name]

activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Hi Ken,

I understand the urgency of your situation and appreciate the clarity you've provided regarding the challenges and potential strategies for your business. Let's break down the options and consider a balanced approach that aligns with your goals and the current market dynamics.

---

### üè¢ Option 1: Stay and Absorb the Rent Increase

**Pros:**

* Established presence in a fashionable, high-traffic downtown area.
* Strong brand recognition among long-term customers.
* Convenient location for clients seeking in-person fittings.

**Cons:**

* The 25% rent increase to \$4,500/month equates to an additional \$54,000 annually.
* Rising operational costs and slower sales growth may strain profitability.
* Potential for further rent hikes due to Centerville's rapid growth.

Industry benchmarks suggest that rent should not exceed 10-12% of total revenue to maintain financial health. With the new rent, your business would need to generate approximately \$540,000 to \$600,000 annually just to cover rent, which may be challenging given current sales trends. ([dojobusiness.com][1])

---

### üöê Option 2: Transition to a Mobile Tailoring Model

**Pros:**

* Significant reduction in overhead costs by eliminating the need for a physical storefront.
* Flexibility to serve clients at their locations, enhancing convenience and potentially expanding your customer base.
* Opportunity to invest in a robust online presence, allowing customers to view clothing options and submit measurements digitally.

**Cons:**

* Loss of the showroom experience, which has been integral to building customer relationships.
* Initial investment required for outfitting a mobile unit and developing an enhanced digital platform.
* Potential challenges in maintaining the personalized service that has set your brand apart.([finmodelslab.com][2])

Studies indicate that businesses emphasizing personalized services can see a boost in profit margins by an average of 15% compared to those offering traditional in-shop services. ([businessplan-templates.com][3])

---

### üîÑ Hybrid Approach: Combining the Best of Both Worlds

**Strategy:**

* Maintain a smaller, cost-effective physical presence that serves as a fitting and consultation hub.
* Expand mobile services to reach clients at their locations, offering convenience and flexibility.
* Develop a comprehensive online platform where customers can explore clothing options, submit measurements, and schedule fittings.([finmodelslab.com][4])

**Benefits:**

* Retain the personal touch and brand identity associated with in-person interactions.
* Reduce reliance on a large physical space, thereby lowering overhead costs.
* Leverage technology to enhance customer experience and streamline operations.

Implementing dynamic pricing strategies and expanding revenue streams through online sales and personalized services can further bolster profitability. ([finmodelslab.com][4])

---

### üß≠ Recommendation

Considering the financial strain posed by the upcoming rent increase and the evolving retail landscape, a hybrid approach seems prudent. By maintaining a modest physical presence while expanding mobile services and enhancing your online platform, you can mitigate costs, retain customer relationships, and position your business for sustainable growth.

I recommend initiating discussions with your landlord to explore options for a more manageable lease agreement. Simultaneously, begin planning the logistics for a mobile unit and the development of an improved online platform. This dual approach will provide flexibility and adaptability in the face of changing market conditions.

Please let me know if you need assistance in outlining a detailed implementation plan or if you'd like to explore specific aspects of this strategy further.

Best regards,
Josh

[1]: https://dojobusiness.com/blogs/news/clothing-store-business-plan?utm_source=chatgpt.com "23 Data For The Business Plan Of A Clothing Store ‚Äì BusinessDojo"
[2]: https://finmodelslab.com/blogs/startup-costs/high-end-tailoring-service?utm_source=chatgpt.com "Affordable Tailoring Business: A Cost Breakdown"
[3]: https://businessplan-templates.com/blogs/startup-costs/tailor?utm_source=chatgpt.com "What Are the 9 Startup Costs Tailoring Your Business? ‚Äì Businessplan-templates.com"
[4]: https://finmodelslab.com/blogs/how-much-makes/clothing-store?utm_source=chatgpt.com "Income Potential for Clothing Store Owners"

activity_instructions: Read an email from your friend and give advice on some stressful problems he is having. Type in the input box. Write 100-200 words.
student_submission:
Hey Leon,

Thanks for reaching out; I'm sorry to hear you're having such a tough time. It sounds like you're dealing with a lot right now, but it's great that you're reaching out.

Regarding work, it's completely understandable to feel stressed when management isn't supportive. Have you considered talking to HR about the lack of recognition? It might be worth exploring your options, like looking for a new job if things don't improve. Remember, your mental health is important, and you deserve to feel valued.

As for Tia, breakups are never easy. Allow yourself to feel the emotions, and don't be afraid to lean on friends and family for support. Focus on activities that bring you joy and help you take care of yourself. Remember that you are worthy of love and happiness.

Take things one day at a time, and be kind to yourself. You've got this. Let's catch up soon, and we can talk more about it.

activity_instructions: Your manager sent you an email, asking you to do the company update. In your own words, write an outline for your presentation. Your outline should include an introduction, the main points, a summary and next steps. Type in the input box. Write 80-120 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
Here's an outline for your company update presentation:

Company Update Presentation Outline

Introduction:

Welcome and thank you.
Brief overview of where we stand as a company.
Highlight the purpose of this update: celebrating successes, acknowledging challenges, and looking ahead.
Main Points:

Key Achievements: Share major milestones, project completions, and team successes from the last quarter.
Performance Metrics: Provide an update on important departmental figures (e.g., sales growth, user engagement, project timelines).
Challenges & Learnings: Discuss any obstacles faced and how we adapted or plan to improve.
Summary:

Recap the essential takeaways and reiterate our overall positive momentum.
Emphasize our collective efforts and progress.
Next Steps:

Outline immediate goals and strategic priorities for the upcoming period.
Call to action for continued collaboration and focus.
What to look forward to in the next update.

activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
From_
ToAll
Josh,

We really have to make a decision about our business. Our landlord just wrote me another letter about the rent. Next month, it will be raised 25% to $4,500 per month. That's going to eat even more into our profits. I mean, Josh, that's $54,000 a year!

I'm going to summarize our discussions here. I know that you are strongly in favor of just staying where we are and paying the higher rent. The obvious disadvantages of that are that our sales of clothing are increasing more slowly than our expenses AND with the rapid growth in Centerville, we can expect further rent increases in the coming months. The big pro for staying is that we're in a fashionable district where long-term customers know us. We're right downtown, so customers can come in on their lunch breaks to be measured for a suit or other high-end clothing.

You know that I favor going to a completely different model. We move to the south end of town for making the clothes, but create a system where we meet people in their offices or schools to measure them for new clothes. We also open up a much better webpage than what we have now so that customers can view our clothing options and enter their measurements. Incredible cost savings! The con of that is that we lose the showroom, where customers can just come in and look at the possibilities, feel the cloth and talk to us about what would be appropriate for them. Far less personalized service, which has helped us build close relationships with our customers.

Honestly, I'd like another option, but I'm out of ideas. Should we talk to more people? I'm up for anything, but we really DO need to make a decision!

Thanks!

activity_instructions: Write about a movie you recently saw. Give facts and opinions about it. Who starred in the movie? Who directed it? What was it about? Type in the input box. Write 60-100 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission: I recently saw "Oppenheimer" directed by Christopher Nolan. The film stars Cillian Murphy as J. Robert Oppenheimer, the father of the atomic bomb. The movie explores Oppenheimer's complex life, from his theoretical work to his leadership role in the Manhattan Project. Murphy's performance is phenomenal, capturing Oppenheimer's intensity and inner turmoil. Nolan's direction is masterful, weaving together historical events and personal struggles. The film is thought-provoking and visually stunning, offering a gripping portrayal of a pivotal moment in history. I highly recommend it for its powerful storytelling and outstanding performances.

activity_instructions: Write about a restaurant meal you had recently. What did you eat? Was the food local or organic? Did you have dessert? Make sure that every clause has a subject followed by a verb. Type in the input box. Write 100-120 words. This activity is non-graded.
student_submission: Last weekend, we had an aperitif at a cozy little restaurant in Rome, in the Prati neighborhood. My sister Elena and I tried Etna, a Sicilian white wine, for the first time. It was dry and slightly sparkling. We also ordered a platter of Italian cheese and ham, plus a delicious, crispy white pizza! The server was lovely and polite. She even added complimentary chips and olives to our order, so we left her a generous tip. The restaurant is in a small pedestrian square, so there's no traffic or annoying noise, making it perfect for a summer night.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Harry good day,
Welcome to the company, I hope you have a good time and accomplish all the stablished goals.
In relation to effectively motivating the team, my suggestion is first to listen to what the team have to tell. Hear all the voices amd at the end, bring up your own conclusion on what are their needs and hoy they like to be treated. Then, understand the culture and how things are being made here, so you can start giving your view and implement the changes or adjustments you think are better for the company and the teams. Finally, respect them, listen to their ideas and take them into account. Lead by example, work hand by hand with the team and deeply understand what they do and where they could get, so you can get the best of each one of us. 
Again, fell free to ask me if you need any support or have any doubts.

activity_instructions: Read an email from your friend and give advice on some stressful problems he is having. Type in the input box. Write 100-200 words.
student_submission:
Hi Leon,
Thanks for opening up - I am really glad you felt you could share this. It sounds like you are carrying a lot right now, and   I am sorry things feel so heavy.

About work, it is tough when leadership does not recognize your efforts. You might try documenting your achievements and gently bringing them up during reviews or one on ones. It is not bragging it is being fair to yourself. If things don not improve, maybe start exploring other options whenever your skills are valued.

You are not alone, Leon. I am always here, and I admire your strength for pushing through this week.

student_submission:

2 - Sales :
  . Quickly increase especially in Asia.
  . Opening a new office in Seoul, Korea.

3 - New CFO:
  . Hiring Mary Rickman as our new CFO
  . Will start next week

I hope you understand that is all good news for our company wich is doing very well. Jane will give you more details when she returns.

I've researched a few team-building companies that offer outdoor activities and meet our requirements:

Deskbird suggests several cost-effective outdoor team-building activities 2. Options like hiking in nature and corporate picnics are excellent for fostering team spirit and ensuring everyone feels comfortable and included.

Deskbird

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Good morning Harry,

   First of all, welcome to the company, you soon wil find out how good and rewarding is to work here.
    I would like to give you some tips  on the matter on how  to motivate the team work.
    Always have in mind that you are dealing with human being, so you need to put yourself in theirs shoes some time to better understand them, so be humble and take some time to listen what they have to say.
    Never, ever, take credit for others employee efforts and  results. Reconize  and praise them for what they have done well.
      If you need to scold or reprimand someone,  call the person into  your work room and  do it in private, do not make a fuss of it, otherwise you wil be feard and hatred by everyone.
      Alwes stays calm and  think before take action, never lose your temper.
      Finally, try to make regular meetings with the staff, it is very important to listen the empoyees, they  will feel important if they have the feeling that their opinios count.

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
Today I was in a meeting with some native English speakers and surprisingly I got the hang of the dialogue with technical words and expressions quite easily. It‚Äôs taken me a while that I‚Äôm studying and practicing English daily, but I‚Äôve never put that skill to the test. I‚Äôve finally managed to talk confidently about my job and the results of my team without hesitation.
I didn‚Äôt think of it then, but this episode showed to me that the more I‚Äôm exposed to the language, the more my brain gets used to it and everything becomes automatic.
One thing that I would do differently is to start earlier, because working without consistency slowed down my progress. So this motivated me even more to continue consistently on my progress of achieve fluency in English. The important fact: don‚Äôt stop and the opportunity to prove the skill will appear in the right moment.
