activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
Corporate Social Responsibility is a key element of each organization, CSR is showing how is the organization cares about the community it works for, that mean each company should assign part of its income to facilitate local community needs. This can be done in form of building hospitals, streets and schools, it can be also in form of recruiting local community people and giving them the required-on job training. Normally these organizations which have a very good CSR system will get the required support and fund from the government which is at the end of the day is a benefit for the company itself. 

Some people don't believe that companies should have a CSR system as it costs a lot of money and reduce the profitability of each organization. When it comes to the local community the company work for then there is no point these companies get a lot of profit from doing business locally and after that they don't share some of their profit for their community. I believe when the local people think those companies' doing business in their area and have a very good CSR reputation, then local people will normally doing business with these comapnies and buy from them their needs.

activity_instructions: You're on holiday in a foreign country. Write a postcard to your friends saying where you are, why you went there, and any other information you'd like to share. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
20 june

Hi, friends!

I hope you‚Äôre doing great! I just got back from the most amazing vacation abroad, and I couldn't wait to tell you all about it.

I spent two unforgettable weeks in Italy. It was my first time traveling to Europe, and honestly, it felt like a dream come true. The trip was packed with history, culture, food, and beautiful landscapes.

My first stop was Rome. I visited the Colosseum, the Roman Forum, and, of course, the Vatican. St. Peter‚Äôs Basilica took my breath away. The Sistine Chapel was even more impressive than I imagined.

After Rome, I took a train to Florence. The art there was incredible ‚Äî I saw Michelangelo‚Äôs David and many paintings by Botticelli and Da Vinci. Florence felt more peaceful than Rome, and I really loved walking along the Arno River.

Then I went to Venice. It was magical! The canals, the gondolas, the little bridges everywhere ‚Äî it felt like a movie. I tried to speak a bit of Italian, and people were friendly and helpful.

The food‚Ä¶ wow. I ate pasta every day, tried dozens of gelato flavors, and drank lots of espresso. I even learned how to make pizza in a cooking class!

Traveling abroad really opened my eyes. I met people from all over the world and learned so much about Italian culture. I took hundreds of pictures and kept a travel journal so I wouldn‚Äôt forget anything.

I also realized how different life can be in another country. Public transport was so efficient. People took time to enjoy their meals and their days. It made me think about our fast-paced life at home.

Of course, there were challenges too ‚Äî getting lost, dealing with language barriers, and figuring out train schedules. But honestly, those things made the trip even more memorable.

Now I‚Äôm already dreaming about my next trip. Maybe France or Japan?

Traveling abroad was one of the best experiences of my life. If you ever get the chance, go for it! I‚Äôd love to travel with you someday ‚Äî imagine the adventures we could have!

Can‚Äôt wait to catch up in person and show you all my photos!

Love,
F.

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
Language learners often face several common challenges. These include the fear of making mistakes, difficulty retaining vocabulary, limited opportunities for speaking and listening practice, and a lack of motivation over time. These issues can slow down progress and make learning frustrating.

To overcome these obstacles, it's important to build a positive and supportive learning environment where students feel safe to practice. Techniques like spaced repetition can help with vocabulary retention, and regular interaction with native speakers improves fluency and confidence. Setting realistic goals and celebrating small achievements also helps keep motivation high.

Although language learning can be difficult, using the right strategies and staying consistent can lead to steady improvement. With patience, practice, and the right mindset, students can succeed and even enjoy the journey.
To overcome these obstacles, it's important to build a positive and supportive learning environment where students feel safe to practice. Techniques like spaced repetition can help with vocabulary retention, and regular interaction with native speakers improves fluency and confidence. Setting realistic goals and celebrating small achievements also helps keep motivation high.

activity_instructions: Read an email from your friend and give advice on some stressful problems he is having. Type in the input box. Write 100-200 words.
student_submission:
Hi Leon,

First of all, you're not bothering anyone by sharing what you're going through‚Äîreaching out is a healthy step in itself. Regarding your work situation, it's completely valid to feel frustrated when your efforts aren't acknowledged. One practical approach is to set small, personal goals that give you a sense of progress, even if management doesn't recognize it. Consider speaking with a trusted colleague or HR about how you‚Äôre feeling‚Äîit might help ease the pressure or even spark change.

As for your relationship with Tia, it‚Äôs natural to grieve when something hopeful begins to unravel. Give yourself space to process it emotionally. It might help to talk to a counselor or even just spend more time with friends doing things you enjoy. Remind yourself that relationships, like jobs, don‚Äôt define your worth.

Try grounding techniques or mindfulness exercises to stay present and reduce anxiety. Journaling your thoughts can also be therapeutic. The fact that you‚Äôre seeking advice shows resilience‚Äîkeep leaning into that strength, and know you‚Äôre not alone in this.

activity_instructions: You're going to reply to Alice's blog post about cross-cultural communication. Give advice about your own culture. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
Hi,Dear Alice
In my culture, clear and respectful communication is highly valued. We avoid slang and speak slowly to ensure everyone understands, especially in cross-cultural settings. Active listening is important; repeating or summarizing what others say helps avoid misunderstandings. Also, paying attention to body language and being patient when language barriers exist fosters trust. Showing empathy and openness to different view points strengthens relationships and helps us work better together across cultures.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
One of the most fascinating legendary creatures from Indian mythology is the Makara, a hybrid aquatic beast known as the vahana (mount) of the river goddess Ganga and the sea god Varuna. The Makara is depicted with a blend of features from various animals‚Äîoften shown with the body of a fish or crocodile, the trunk of an elephant, the tail of a peacock, and sometimes even the tusks of a wild boar. This unique combination makes it a formidable yet sacred creature associated with water, strength, and protection.
In Hindu and Buddhist iconography, Makara often guards temple entrances, symbolizing its role as a protector against evil forces. It is also believed to be a carrier of energy, transitioning between the physical and spiritual worlds. The Makara's presence in carvings and ancient texts highlights its importance across different traditions. Some interpretations suggest that it embodies the unpredictability and depth of water‚Äîa force that can be nurturing but also powerful and untamable.
With its fusion of features and deep spiritual significance, the Makara remains one of India‚Äôs most intriguing mythological beings, inspiring awe and reverence even today.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Harry,

Welcome aboard, and congratulations on your new role!

Here are some ideas for effectively motivating your team, along with a few things to avoid:

Start by building trust. Be approachable, consistent, and transparent in your communication. Encourage collaboration and celebrate both team and individual achievements. Show genuine interest in your employees' growth‚Äîoffer mentorship, support training opportunities, and help them set meaningful career goals.

Make sure people feel valued. A simple ‚Äúthank you‚Äù or recognizing someone‚Äôs good work can go a long way. Promote a culture where feedback is constructive and two-way. Also, encourage a healthy work-life balance to prevent burnout.

Avoid common demotivators like micromanaging, ignoring contributions, or taking credit for others‚Äô efforts. Don‚Äôt overlook the importance of fairness‚Äîblaming others for mistakes or failing to acknowledge success can quickly damage morale. Finally, never let stress cause you to disrespect your team.

Lead by example, stay humble, and remember: a motivated team starts with a motivated leader.

All the best in your new position!

activity_instructions: Your boss has asked you to write a formal report recommending a training company. You've chosen Skills Pro. Use your notes to write up the report. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
We looked at two training companies: TrainQuick and Skills Pro.

TrainQuick: cheap and flexible, but people aren't using it in the other branch. Employees don't like it when we mix them with people from other branches in their classes.

Skills Pro: more expensive; people have described the course content as difficult, but people who take the course often finish it successfully. They plan to expand the course, too.

Probably go with Skills Pro ‚Äì yes, more expensive, but quality counts.Training Provider Decision Summary

We reviewed two training providers: TrainQuick and Skills Pro.

TrainQuick offers low-cost and flexible training options. However, uptake has been poor in the other branch, and employees have expressed discomfort with mixed-branch training sessions.

Skills Pro is more expensive, and some have found the content challenging. However, participants tend to complete the courses successfully, and the provider is planning to expand its offerings.

Recommendation: Proceed with Skills Pro. Despite the higher cost, it offers better outcomes, and employee experience and course quality are key priorities.

Let me know if you‚Äôd like this turned into a presentation slide or memo.

student_submission:
One legendary creature I find very interesting is the Wendigo, a mythical monster from Native American folklore, especially among the Algonquian-speaking tribes in North America. The Wendigo is said to be a spirit or creature that appears in cold, snowy forests and is often associated with greed, hunger, and isolation.
 
According to the legend, the Wendigo was once a human who became possessed by an evil spirit after turning to cannibalism during a harsh winter. As punishment, the person transformed into a monster‚Äîtall, thin, with glowing eyes, sharp teeth, and a heart made of ice. No matter how much it eats, the Wendigo is always hungry, constantly searching for more victims to satisfy its endless craving.
 
The story of the Wendigo was used as a warning against selfishness and losing one‚Äôs humanity in desperate times. It also served as a way to explain strange disappearances or dangerous behavior during long winters.
 
Many books, movies, and games now feature the Wendigo, turning it into a popular creature beyond its original folklore. It remains one of the most chilling and fascinating monsters in North American mythology.

activity_instructions: Write an online post giving your opinion about TV or a show that you like. Give an example to support your opinion, and end your post with an action step, suggestion or recommendation. Type in the input box. Write 50-90 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
The Library of Alexandria (Ancient Greek: ŒíŒπŒ≤ŒªŒπŒøŒ∏ŒÆŒ∫Œ∑ œÑ·øÜœÇ ·ºàŒªŒµŒæŒ¨ŒΩŒ¥œÅŒµŒπŒ±œÇ; Latin: Bibliotheca Alexandrina) was one of the most significant and celebrated libraries and one of the greatest centers of knowledge production in antiquity. Established during the 3rd century BC in the palace complex of the city of Alexandria in the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Ancient Egypt, the Library was part of a research institution called the Mouseion. The idea for its creation may have been proposed by Demetrius of Phalerum, an exiled Athenian statesman, to the satrap of Egypt and founder of the Ptolemaic dynasty, Ptolemy I Soter, who, like his predecessor, Alexander the Great, sought to promote the spread of Hellenistic culture. However, the Library was probably not built until the reign of his son, Ptolemy II Philadelphus. It acquired a large number of papyrus scrolls, mainly due to the aggressive and well-funded policies of the Ptolemaic kings to obtain texts. It is not known exactly how many works it had in its collection, but it is estimated that it once housed between thirty thousand and seven hundred thousand literary, academic and religious volumes. The Library's collection grew to such an extent that, during the reign of Ptolemy III Euergetes, a branch was established in the Serapeum of Alexandria.

In addition to serving as a demonstration of power for the Ptolemaic rulers, the Library played a significant role in the emergence of Alexandria as the successor to Athens as a center of Greek culture. Many important and influential scholars worked on it, notably Zenodotus of Ephesus, who sought to standardize the texts of the Homeric poems and produced the earliest known record of the use of alphabetical order as a method of organization; Callimachus, who wrote the Pinakes, probably the world's first library catalogue; Apollonius of Rhodes, who composed the epic poem The Argonautica; Eratosthenes of Cyrene, who first calculated the conditions of the Earth, with unusual results; Aristophanes of Byzantium, who invented the system of Greek diacritics and was the first to divide poetic texts into lines; and Aristarchus of Samothrace, who produced the definitive texts of the Homeric poems and extensive commentaries on them. In addition to these, there are references to the community of the Library and Mouseion of Alexandria also having temporarily included numerous other figures who developed rigorous scholarship, such as Archimedes and Euclid.

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
Language students often face a variety of issues and challenges during their language journey. One common difficulty is mastering pronunciation and listening skills, especially when souns in the new language do not exist in their native tongue. 
In this situation, one thing learners need to do is spending a lot of time listening to the language they learn. It can be music, podcasts, youtube, cartoons or series etc. However, students must be cautious when choosing the right content in order to actually understand the meaning of what was said. Because otherwise this kind of practise will not matter.
Eventually, after doing this for long enough, students will get the hang of the language and will realise that pronouncig new sound is actually a a lot easyer than they thought before. 
But the best practise will always come from a native speaker. Even after learning the language for several years, people might find it surprisingly difficult to speak to natives. Still, they should not be afraid to speak up, but should keep in mind that everything comes naturally with the practice.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
One of the most fascinating legendary creatures in India is the Nag‚Äîa mystical serpent found in Hindu mythology. These divine beings are often depicted as half-human, half-snake entities, possessing great wisdom and supernatural abilities. Nagas are believed to reside in underground realms or sacred waters, guarding treasures and ancient secrets. They are both revered and feared, symbolizing fertility, protection, and transformation.

In Hindu epics like the Mahabharata, famous Nagas such as Vasuki and Ananta appear alongside powerful deities. Vasuki, the king of serpents, played a vital role in the churning of the ocean to obtain amrita, the nectar of immortality. Ananta, a thousand-headed serpent, is said to be the eternal resting couch of Lord Vishnu, signifying infinity and cosmic balance.

Despite their revered status, Nagas can also be vengeful if disrespected. Legends warn against harming snakes, as they might retaliate with misfortune. Even today, many temples across India are dedicated to Nagas, and festivals like Nag Panchami celebrate their spiritual significance.
Their presence in mythology, folklore, and religious traditions makes them one of the most intriguing legendary creatures in Indian culture.

I believe proactively addressing these areas will position us for sustained growth and success.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
The Garuda is a legendary creature deeply rooted in Indian mythology and is revered as a divine being in Hinduism. Described as a colossal, eagle-like bird with the body of a man, Garuda is the mount (vahana) of Lord Vishnu, one of the principal deities in Hinduism. Often depicted with a golden, radiant body, mighty wings, and an imposing beak, Garuda symbolizes power, speed, and martial prowess.

In various texts, Garuda is portrayed as a sworn enemy of serpents, embodying the eternal struggle between good and evil. This enmity is often attributed to his mission to free his mother from servitude by obtaining the nectar of immortality. Garuda's birth is itself a tale of divine intervention‚Äîhatched from a massive egg laid by his mother, Vinata, after a prolonged and arduous penance.

Garuda's imagery is prevalent in Indian art and architecture, often seen adorning temples and sacred sites as a guardian figure. Beyond Hinduism, Garuda holds significance in Buddhist and Jain traditions, embodying virtues such as loyalty and bravery. His legacy transcends religious boundaries, making Garuda an enduring symbol of divine intervention and moral righteousness in Indian culture.

activity_instructions: Your boss has asked you to write a formal report recommending a training company. You've chosen Skills Pro. Use your notes to write up the report. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Following a review of two training providers, TrainQuick and Skills Pro, I recommend that we select Skills Pro for our staff development needs.

While TrainQuick offers lower costs and flexible schedules, it has notable drawbacks. Feedback from the other branch indicates that employees are not engaging with TrainQuick‚Äôs courses. Additionally, mixing our staff with participants from other branches has been reported as unpopular, affecting overall satisfaction.

On the other hand, Skills Pro, despite being more expensive, provides higher-quality training. Some participants have described the course content as challenging, but completion rates are high, suggesting the material is effective and worthwhile. Furthermore, Skills Pro is planning to expand its courses, which may provide additional benefits and options for our staff in the future.

In conclusion, although Skills Pro involves a higher investment, the superior training quality and positive outcomes justify the cost. I recommend proceeding with Skills Pro to ensure our employees receive the best possible training experience.

[Maria]

Company Update Presentation Outline

student_submission:
TRAINING COMPANY EVALUATION REPORT
Masako Nakakuki, 21st June 2025

Considering the necessary skills and benefits for our employees, I‚Äôve evaluated two leading training companies, Skills Pro and TrainQuick, to see which company would be better fit our company.

First, I‚Äôve conducted a quick survey among the HR team who took a trial class of the two companies.
I asked them to rate from five stars to one star as follows from various perspectives.  I‚Äôve also added some notable comments as subordinate factors.

‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ	Excellent
‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ	Good
‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ	Fair
‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ	Need Improvement
‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ	Not Satisfied

Skills Pro:
Cost		‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ
Flexibility	‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ
Course Level	‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ
Curriculum	‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ
Variations	‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ
Note: While the cost by itself is less competitive, the course level and class variations are higher than expected.  It‚Äôs fairly challenging to increase motivation to finish the course.  Another plus point is that they are planning to expand the course starting next year.  In this sense, the cost matches the quality and their future possibilities.

TrainQuick:
Cost		‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ
Flexibility	‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ
Course Level	‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ
Curriculum	‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ
Variations	‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ
Note: Their strength are the low cost and flexibility.  While the courses at Skills Pro are fixed, they are open to customize their courses based on our needs which is appreciative.  However, their course level doesn‚Äôt meet our expectations so that some employees are less confident with their skills when being mixed with people from other branches who are taking training of other company.

Summary and Recommendations
Overall, Skills Pro appears to be the more beneficial option for our company despite its relatively higher cost.  The overall satisfaction among HR members who participated in the Skills Pro trial class was significantly higher than that of TrainQuick.  
Given their strong curriculum, high course level, and promising growth potential, I highly recommend adopting Skill‚Äôs Pro‚Äôs training programs to support the continued development of our employees.

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
My Opinion on Corporate Social Responsibility

I strongly believe that companies have a responsibility not only to their shareholders but also to society as a whole. In today‚Äôs interconnected world, businesses are no longer isolated entities focused solely on profit. They operate within communities, use natural resources, and impact people‚Äôs lives in countless ways. Therefore, it is only fair that they give back and act responsibly.

Corporate social responsibility (CSR) is not just an ethical obligation‚Äîit is also a smart long-term strategy. Companies that treat their employees well, protect the environment, and support local communities often enjoy greater customer loyalty and employee satisfaction. As mentioned by Jack@MSU, many consumers actively support companies with strong CSR records, which can translate into better business performance.

Moreover, in the age of social media, corporate behavior is under constant public scrutiny. One irresponsible act can damage a brand's reputation quickly. On the other hand, responsible actions can build trust and goodwill. It‚Äôs no longer enough for a business to say ‚Äúwe follow the law.‚Äù People expect more‚Äîand rightly so.

While I agree that governments should regulate business practices, this doesn‚Äôt mean companies should stop at the bare minimum. CSR is about going beyond what‚Äôs required and doing what‚Äôs right. In the end, companies that support society also create a better environment for their own success.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Harry,

Here are some ideas for motivating your employees. I also included some things to avoid.

-Sincere praise, positive feedback, and public recognition are powerful. Celebrate small wins and milestones.

-Communicate clearly and frequently
Keep everyone informed about goals, changes, and expectations. Active listening ‚Äî allow room for ideas and concerns.

-Give autonomy with accountability
Trust your team to make decisions within their roles. Avoid micromanaging ‚Äî show them that you believe in their abilities.

-Offer opportunities for growth
Encourage training, workshops, and personal development. Show them career progression paths.

-Create a positive, collaborative environment
Foster empathy, respect, and teamwork.
Lead by example ‚Äî be an inspirational person.

-Align personal goals with those of the company
Understand what motivates each individual team member.
Help them see how their work contributes to the whole.

-Offer meaningful rewards
Fair pay and benefits are important, but rewards don‚Äôt always have to be financial (e.g., time off, events, personalized thank yous).

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Dear Harry,

Here are some tried-and-true ways to foster a positive, motivated team environment‚Äîas well as some common missteps to avoid.

To truly engage your employees, start by **incentivizing their efforts**. Whether through performance bonuses, recognition programs, or simple acknowledgment, showing that success is shared creates a culture of ownership. Take a real interest in their professional growth too. Providing training opportunities and mentoring shows you're invested in their future, not just their output.

Equally important is encouraging a **healthy work-life balance**. Let your team know their well-being matters. When people feel respected as whole individuals, they tend to give their best. And never underestimate the power of listening‚Äîvalidation goes a long way in building loyalty and trust. Finally, lead with empathy: treat your team how you‚Äôd want to be treated by your own boss.

Avoid pitfalls like taking undue credit, placing blame unfairly, or showing disrespect. These actions quickly undo all your efforts. A little appreciation and humility can go a long way.

Wishing you and your team all the best,  
EF Student

student_submission:
CSR is a good opportunity for companies to review their governance and establish new principles, take into consideration stakeholders for sure, but focusing more on their employees and on the society in general.   

The relevance of companies in our society is beyond any discussion. For that reason, it‚Äôs important to have this king of regulatory initiatives, but they must be accompanied by rigorous compliance monitoring. 

Although this law could represent and important increase in companies‚Äô cost, it‚Äôs also evident that it brings important benefits, such us improvement in public company image, employees sense of satisfaction. 

Some people believe that CSR is just a publicity stunt, and probably it is in some cases, but we can only benefit from companies that apply these new rules. Additionally, these kinds of initiatives increase companies‚Äô and individuals‚Äô social awareness. From my point of view, we probably have a long way to go, but every bit counts. 

In sum, I believe society is changing and social awareness is growing. For that reason, companies should take advantage of this kind of initiative. Stakeholders should take these factors into consideration before investing their money and should encourage companies to adopt these policies. 
 It‚Äôs a clear win-win.

activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Subject: A Compromise Proposal: The Hybrid Boutique Model

Dear Josh and Ken,

I hope this email finds you well. After carefully considering your discussions, I propose a third option that combines the strengths of your current model with the innovative approach of reaching customers in new ways.

Why not establish a hybrid boutique model? We could relocate our main showroom to a more affordable, yet still central, location in Centerville, such as a cozy, high-traffic spot in the emerging arts district. This area is rapidly gaining popularity and offers lower rent compared to downtown, allowing us to maintain a physical presence without the hefty price tag.

Simultaneously, we could launch a mobile fitting service. Trained staff would travel to various corporate offices and educational institutions across Centerville, equipped with fabric swatches and advanced, portable measuring tools. This service would cater to busy professionals and students, offering them the convenience of being measured and consulted on-site.

Additionally, we would invest in an interactive e-commerce platform. Customers could virtually experience our clothing through 3D models and augmented reality features, allowing them to see and feel the cloth digitally. They could input their measurements or schedule a mobile fitting appointment online. This would preserve the personalized service you value while expanding our reach.

The hybrid model balances cost savings with customer experience, ensuring we stay competitive and connected to our clientele.

Best regards,
Me

activity_instructions: Your boss has asked you to write a formal report recommending a training company. You've chosen Skills Pro. Use your notes to write up the report. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Training Partner Selection Report: Choice of SKILLSPro

After careful evaluation of both training providers‚ÄîTrainQuick and SKILLSPro‚Äîwe recommend proceeding with SKILLSPro as our preferred training partner.

While TrainQuick offers a cost-effective and flexible solution, our internal feedback indicates that it has not been adopted effectively in other branches. A key concern is the negative response from employees about being grouped with participants from different branches. This inter-branch mixing has led to dissatisfaction and diminished engagement in the learning process.

In contrast, SKILLSPro, though comparatively more expensive, demonstrates a significantly stronger value proposition. The course content is rigorous, and while initially perceived as challenging, it has a strong record of participant completion. This speaks to the program's structure, support mechanisms, and effectiveness. Furthermore, SKILLSPro is planning to expand its course offerings, which aligns well with our long-term goals of continuous upskilling and professional development.

In summary, although SKILLSPro demands a higher investment, it offers a superior learning experience, higher engagement, and better outcomes. Quality training yields long-term returns, making this choice both strategic and sustainable.

student_submission:
Title: The Importance of Friendship

Friendship is one of the most valuable aspects of human life. A true friend is someone who supports you, listens to you, and shares both happy and difficult moments with you. Without friends, life can feel lonely and less meaningful.

Friendship teaches us empathy, patience, and trust. When we are with friends, we learn how to cooperate, communicate, and care for others. Good friends help us become better people. They encourage us to reach our goals and stand by us when we fail.

In today‚Äôs fast-paced world, it is easy to lose touch with friends. That is why it is important to make time for them and keep the connection strong. Whether through a simple message, a call, or spending time together, maintaining friendships requires effort.

In conclusion, friends are not just people we enjoy spending time with‚Äîthey are essential to our emotional well-being. A life with strong friendships is a life full of love, laughter, and support.

Walk of fame

Since 1960, the Hollywood Boulevard Avenue attracts visitors to see star-plaques with the names of celebrities: actors, singers, movie directors, stage performers or anyone who has contributed to make Hollywood known worldwide. The Internet: A Remarkable Invention
The internet is one of the most amazing inventions in modern history. It all began in the 1960s when scientists created a way for computers to talk to each other. Today, it plays a crucial role in our lives, allowing us to connect with people from all over the world, find information, and enjoy a world of entertainment. I‚Äôve been studying English for a few years now, and throughout this journey, I‚Äôve faced many challenges.

As language students, I believe we should focus on expanding our vocabulary. Personally, this has been quite difficult due to the massive number of words in English. However, I‚Äôve finally managed to improve my pronunciation, thanks to consuming content in the language I‚Äôm learning. On the other hand, one of the biggest challenges is the lack of practice opportunities, especially if you live in a Spanish-speaking country. This didn‚Äôt come as a big surprise. Without regular exposure to real situations where you need to speak, it‚Äôs easy to avoid using the language. In the end, getting the hang of a language is a long-term process full of ups and downs, but staying motivated and finding creative ways to practice can make a big difference.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Gandeberunda
You probably already know the story of Narasimha, Vishnu‚Äôs hybrid avatar. Evil demon Hiranyakashipu gets a boon from Brahma that makes him practically invincible, which in turn gives him the licence to terrorize everyone. But when he tries to murder his own son, Vishnu decides that enough is enough and vanquishes Hiranyakashipu in the most creative way (you see, all boons come with loopholes) in his Narasimha avatar.

The story doesn‚Äôt end there though. Even with Hiranyakashipu out of the picture, Narasimha is still really, really angry, and afraid that his anger issues would destroy the world, the gods beseech Shiva to do something. Of course, the only way to tackle a powerful mythical creature is to turn into a powerful mythical creature yourself. Shiva becomes Sharabha ‚Äì a half-lion (to match Narasimha, understandably) and half-bird form (the OG Angry Bird) ‚Äì and manages to subdue Narasimha. The story is still not over, because Narasimha becomes Angrier Bird ‚Äì taking on the form of Gandeberunda, a gigantic two-headed bird with Hulk-like strength. Sharabha, thankfully, calls it quits after 18 days of fighting and Gandeberunda also finally calms down. This powerful bird happens to be the state emblem of Karnataka, and the Gandeberunda motif can be found in many places in India, including temple architecture.

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is a topic that sparks diverse opinions. On one hand, proponents argue that companies have a duty to contribute positively to society. They believe that businesses, as integral parts of the communities they operate in, should engage in sustainable practices and support local initiatives. This perspective emphasizes a symbiotic relationship where both the company and the community benefit. For instance, sustainable operations ensure long-term viability, while fair employee benefits lead to higher productivity and lower turnover rates. Additionally, companies with strong CSR records often enjoy enhanced customer loyalty, which translates to better financial performance and broader societal benefits.

On the other hand, critics of CSR argue that the primary responsibility of a business is to its shareholders. They cite Milton Friedman's assertion that the main goal of a corporation is to maximize profits. From this viewpoint, CSR activities are seen as distractions from the core business objectives. Critics also point out that the contributions made by corporations to social causes are often minimal compared to their overall earnings, suggesting that CSR can be a superficial marketing tool rather than a genuine effort to effect change. Furthermore, they argue that it is the government's role to create and enforce regulations that benefit the public, not the corporations'.

In conclusion, while CSR can enhance a company's reputation and foster customer loyalty, it is essential to balance these activities with the primary goal of profit maximization. Ultimately, the debate hinges on whether businesses should prioritize societal benefits alongside shareholder interests or focus solely on financial performance.

Vacations are a time to step away from the routine of daily life, recharge, and explore new places or activities. Whether it's lounging on a sunny beach, hiking through scenic mountains, or discovering the vibrant culture of a new city, holidays provide an opportunity to take a break from work and daily responsibilities.

For many people, vacations are a chance to reconnect with loved ones, spend quality time with family and friends, or even enjoy some much-needed solo relaxation. Traveling can broaden one's perspective by experiencing different cultures, foods, and languages, enriching the mind and spirit.

The benefits of vacations are more than just a temporary escape. Studies show that taking regular breaks can help reduce stress, improve mental health, and increase productivity once back at work. It‚Äôs important to plan a vacation that suits your interests‚Äîwhether it's adventure, leisure, or simply unwinding in nature.

In today's world, there are endless options for vacation destinations, from exotic tropical islands to charming small towns and bustling metropolitan cities. The key is to choose a place that allows you to unwind, recharge, and make memories that will last a lifetime.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Maria,

Congratulations on your new role as manager. As you begin leading your team, motivating them effectively will be key to achieving both individual and collective success.

First, incentivizing your employees is essential. Clearly link their contributions to the company‚Äôs success, and offer rewards‚Äîboth monetary and non-monetary‚Äîas a way to acknowledge their efforts. This fosters a sense of ownership and purpose within the team.

Additionally, take an active interest in each team member‚Äôs career development. Offer mentorship and opportunities for further training, demonstrating that you are invested in their growth. This helps build trust and loyalty.

Equally important is promoting a healthy work-life balance. Encourage employees to disconnect when needed and respect their personal time. A balanced life leads to greater productivity and job satisfaction.

Finally, ensure you consistently listen to your team‚Äôs concerns. Regular feedback sessions can create an open dialogue, allowing you to address issues before they escalate.

Avoid behaviors that could undermine morale, such as taking credit for others' work, losing your temper, or failing to provide praise. These actions can demotivate your team and erode trust.

Best of luck in your new position.

activity_instructions: You're going to reply to Alice's blog post about cross-cultural communication. Give advice about your own culture. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
Understanding Cultural Differences in the Workplace

I work in an international company, and one of the most important lessons I have learned is the value of understanding cultural differences. Working with colleagues and clients from around the world has taught me that communication styles vary greatly depending on culture, and knowing these differences can make all the difference in building successful relationships.

For example, in my culture, people often greet each other with a firm handshake and smile. However, in some countries, a bow or a nod is the proper way to show respect. I once met a client who seemed distant at first, but later I realized that in their culture, maintaining a lot of personal space is a sign of respect, not coldness.

Another interesting difference is in the way people express disagreement. In my culture, it is normal to speak openly and directly, even if it means saying "no" or pointing out mistakes. In other cultures, people prefer to be more indirect to avoid causing embarrassment or offense. This sometimes caused confusion during meetings until I learned to read between the lines.

I also noticed that humor can be very different from one culture to another. What is funny in one place may be confusing or even offensive in another. I once told a joke during a business lunch, and I could tell immediately that it didn‚Äôt land well. Since then, I have become more careful about humor in professional settings.

Body language is another area full of surprises. For example, in some cultures, nodding means agreement, but in others, it simply means that the person is listening. Similarly, gestures that seem harmless to me may be rude or inappropriate elsewhere. I learned to observe carefully before using my usual expressions.

One thing that has helped me a lot is being patient and asking questions when I am unsure. People usually appreciate it when you show interest in their culture. It opens the door to better understanding and trust.

Of course, adapting to different cultures does not mean losing your own identity. It means showing respect and willingness to learn. Even small efforts, like greeting people properly or avoiding sensitive topics, can build stronger connections.

I believe that in today‚Äôs global workplace, cultural awareness is not just a nice skill to have‚Äîit is essential. The ability to communicate effectively across cultures helps avoid misunderstandings and creates a more inclusive and productive environment.

In conclusion, working internationally has taught me to be more open-minded and flexible. It has been a rewarding experience that has enriched both my professional and personal life. I encourage anyone who works with people from different backgrounds to take time to learn about their cultures. It makes work more enjoyable and successful.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Harry,

These tips are a great foundation for becoming a strong and respected leader. Motivating employees isn‚Äôt just about offering rewards‚Äîit‚Äôs about creating a positive, supportive work environment where people feel valued and heard. When you show genuine interest in your employees‚Äô growth and well-being, they‚Äôre more likely to stay engaged and perform at their best. Encouraging a healthy work-life balance, providing training opportunities, and acting as a mentor helps employees feel that they matter beyond just their job title.

Listening is another key element. Even when employees have complaints, just knowing their voice matters can boost morale and trust. Always treat others the way you‚Äôd want to be treated‚Äîthis builds mutual respect and loyalty.

At the same time, avoiding demotivators is just as important. Nothing destroys team spirit faster than disrespect, taking credit unfairly, or losing your temper. Praise good work often‚Äîit costs nothing but means a lot.

Wishing you great success with your team!

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
One of the most iconic legendary creatures in Mexican folklore is La Llorona, or The Weeping Woman. According to legend, she was once a beautiful woman named Maria who, driven by grief or vengeance, drowned her children in a river and was condemned to roam the earth for eternity.

Draped in a flowing white dress, La Llorona is said to appear near rivers or lakes, crying for her lost children with the eerie wail, ‚Äú¬°Ay, mis hijos!‚Äù (‚ÄúOh, my children!‚Äù). Witnesses describe her as ghostly and sorrowful, often vanishing when approached.

Her story serves as both a cautionary tale for children and a chilling reflection of guilt and tragedy. Beyond fear, La Llorona symbolizes the consequences of broken family bonds and the torment of remorse. Deeply rooted in colonial-era myths and indigenous beliefs, her legend has endured through centuries, evolving into a cultural icon that inspires films, literature, and urban legends throughout Latin America.

In essence, La Llorona is more than a ghost‚Äîshe is a haunting embodiment of sorrow and punishment. Her cries still echo in the collective imagination of a nation.

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
In today's interconnected world, I believe companies absolutely have a responsibility to society- not just to their shareholders. While making a profit is essential, businesses don't operate in a vacuum. They rely on people, communities, and the environment to thrive. Ignoring that relationship would be short- sighted.

As some have pointed out, CSR isn't just charity-it's smarty strategy. When companies treat employees fairly, support local communities, and reduce environmental harm, they build trust and loyalty. That leads to higher productivity, lower turnover, and stronger customer relationships.
Sure, governments create laws to protect the public. But laws to protect the public. But laws often lag behind public needs, and companies have the power- and the resources-to act faster. corporate social responsibility fills in those gaps.
In the end, doing good and doing well can go hand in hand. CSR is not a distraction from business-it's part of how modern businesses stay competitive and relevant in a changing world.
theG8T
Yes, companies should absolutely be responsible to society, not just shareholders. Business benefit from the communities they operate in, so giving back is only fair. CSR builds trust, boosts employee morale, and attracts loyal customers.

activity_instructions: Your boss has asked you to write a formal report recommending a training company. You've chosen Skills Pro. Use your notes to write up the report. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Report:
As requested, we reviewed two training providers: TrainQuick and Skills Pro.

TrainQuick offers low-cost and flexible training programs. However, feedback from our other branch indicates that staff are not engaging with their courses. Additionally, employees have expressed dissatisfaction with mixed-branch training sessions, stating that they prefer learning alongside their immediate colleagues.

Skills Pro, while more expensive, has shown stronger results. Although some participants have found the course content challenging, completion rates remain high, indicating that employees are motivated to finish. Moreover, Skills Pro plans to expand its program offerings, which could provide us with more specialized training options in the future.

Taking these factors into account, I recommend choosing Skills Pro as our preferred training provider. While the cost is higher, the quality and effectiveness of the training justify the investment. A well-trained team is essential to maintaining high performance and ensuring long-term growth. Skills Pro‚Äôs proven success rate and plans for expansion suggest that it can support our staff‚Äôs professional development not only now but also as our needs evolve. This makes it a more sustainable and strategic choice for the company.

In a quiet village nestled between rolling hills and vast fields of golden wheat, time seemed to move slower than in the rest of the world. The streets were narrow and paved with cobblestones worn smooth by centuries of footsteps. Children laughed as they played beneath the tall oak trees, their voices echoing through the valley. In the distance, an old church bell chimed softly, marking the hour with a deep, familiar tone that brought comfort to all who heard it.

Every morning, the villagers would wake to the scent of freshly baked bread drifting from the small bakery near the square. Farmers led their animals through the fields, and shopkeepers arranged their goods with care, ready to greet both neighbors and travelers. Life was simple here‚Äînot without hardship, but filled with meaning. People helped one another without expecting anything in return, and kindness was the most common language spoken.

As the sun dipped below the horizon and the sky turned a soft shade of violet, families gathered for supper, sharing stories, laughter, and dreams. It was in this peaceful rhythm that the village lived‚Äînot chasing time, but living fully within it.

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
Learning English: A Journey

Learning English is an exciting and rewarding journey. It opens doors to new opportunities, whether in your career, personal life, or travel. The key to mastering the language is consistency and practice. You can start by reading books, watching movies, or speaking with native speakers. It might feel challenging at first, but with time and effort, you will see progress. 
Many learners of English face challenges along the way. One of the most common obstacles is the fear of making mistakes. But remember, mistakes are a natural part of learning! Every time you make an error, you're learning something new. Overcoming this fear is key to gaining confidence.

One of the most important aspects of learning English is vocabulary. The more words you know, the easier it will be to express yourself. Don‚Äôt be afraid to make mistakes ‚Äì it‚Äôs part of the learning process! Listening to English podcasts or music can also help improve your pronunciation and understanding of different accents.

Remember, learning a new language takes patience, so enjoy the process. The more you practice, the more confident you will become.

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
Language learning is one of the most common challenge for various people from high school students to business person who are belonging to some international companies.
From my point of view, the most difficult thing is the different compositions between what we use and what we learn.
Most of us, Japanese, learn English in our middle high school, high school and university. The teachers offer a general English skills ‚Äî common words, idioms, composition/structure and also pronunciation. However, many of us can't speak with someone from abroad because of lack of confidence nor vague memory about the language.
I didn't really think of it then, but what I should have done in my student era was not remembering as much word as possible, but writing/speaking English as much as possible to build my confidence to express something in English.

When we try to speak foreign language, we often hesitate to have a mistake, but who cares?
In reality, no one cares about our English skill ‚Äî if there is someone who cares about it, their expectation for our English skill is always lower than we think. So, what we need to do is only using English without any hesitation.
 
I don't know how much it effect on our actual English speaking skills, but I might suggest you to record and hear your English speaking from not only pronunciation point of view but also from confidence point of view ‚Äî we're better speaker than we imagine.

activity_instructions: You're going to reply to Alice's blog post about cross-cultural communication. Give advice about your own culture. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
I work for a global company. I've been lucky enough to travel around the world and do business with many different people in many different countries. What I've learned is that understanding cross-cultural differences is critical for successful communication.

For example, people from my culture are apt to maintain eye contact in a conversation. In some countries I've visited, however, maintaining eye contact can be considered rather rude or even aggressive. I also have a way of gesturing a lot ‚Äì you know, like moving my hands and pointing. In one country, I learned that pointing with a finger is somewhat impolite. Oh, yeah ‚Äì and I have a tendency to talk a lot and be quite direct. I also tend to be a little uncomfortable with silence. There are a lot of countries where just the opposite is true.

I guess my point is that it's important to be sensitive to the culture you're working in. You don't have to be perfect, but a little understanding goes a long way!

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
Corporate social responsibility (CSR) is not just an ethical obligation; it is a strategic necessity that benefits both society and businesses alike. Companies operate within communities, rely on employees and resources, and engage with consumers who are increasingly concerned with social and environmental impact. Therefore, businesses have a duty beyond profit-making to contribute positively to society.
One key argument for CSR is its direct correlation with consumer trust and brand loyalty. As Jack@MSU pointed out, companies with strong CSR practices tend to build lasting relationships with their customers, which ultimately strengthens their financial performance. Ethical operations, environmental sustainability, and fair employee treatment foster goodwill and create a reputation that attracts stakeholders and talent.
Furthermore, CSR ensures long-term business sustainability. Sustainable operations and investments in community welfare mitigate risks and enhance resilience, making companies more adaptable to changing social expectations and regulations. As lil@213 mentioned, business and community relationships should be mutually beneficial, ensuring future prosperity for both.
On the opposing side, critics argue that CSR can be used as a marketing tool or a superficial attempt at goodwill. JackD_92 highlighted that corporate contributions to social causes are often minuscule compared to overall earnings. While this may be true for some businesses, dismissing CSR entirely overlooks the broader impact of ethical business practices.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
The Royal Bengal Tiger, India‚Äôs national animal, is a majestic and powerful predator known for its striking appearance and elusive nature. With a vibrant orange coat marked by bold black stripes, a white underbelly, and piercing amber eyes, it commands both awe and respect. Native to the Indian subcontinent, it primarily inhabits mangrove forests like the Sundarbans, as well as grasslands and tropical jungles.

This subspecies of tiger is among the largest in the world, with males weighing up to 220‚Äì260 kg and measuring nearly 3 meters in length, including the tail. It is a solitary and territorial animal, relying on stealth and strength to hunt prey such as deer, wild boar, and occasionally livestock.

Despite its iconic status, the Royal Bengal Tiger faces threats from habitat loss, poaching, and human-wildlife conflict. Conservation efforts under Project Tiger and protected reserves have helped stabilize its population, but continued vigilance is essential to ensure its survival in the wild.

You do not need to write the addresses, greetings or the closing. Use a formal tone. Type in the input box. Write 80-100 words. Use your own words where possible.

Hi [Boss‚Äôs Name],

I hope you're having a great week so far. I wanted to check in with a few quick questions to help with planning over the next few weeks.

First, do you plan to attend the conference next month? Knowing your schedule will help us coordinate upcoming meetings more effectively. On that note, do you think we should postpone the next company meeting until after the conference to ensure full attendance and focus?

activity_instructions: An old friend has emailed you, describing what he's been doing for the last decade. Pretend you have two kids living abroad, and write a response describing what they have been doing. Type in the input box. Write 50-100 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission: Hey! I got your email address from our old friend, Valerie. I can't believe that we've only seen each other once in the last 20 years! A lot has happened in my life since then. About five years ago, Stella and I moved with our son Jeremy to Oxford, New Zealand, and lived out in the country. I did contract design work. You know that's what I've always loved. Stella taught math in a local university. Jeremy went to school and made a lot of friends. Eventually, though, we ended up back in St. Louis, where we've been living for the past year. I'm working for a design firm, and Stella has been teaching in a university. We bought a little two-bedroom house in the suburbs, and we're basically happy, but sometimes we feel that something's missing. The suburbs are crowded, and the houses all look the same. Jeremy left for college, so we're lonely, old empty nesters looking for a change. We're actually thinking about adopting a child. At our age, are we crazy? Anyway, let's reconnect. Your kids must be all grown up now. How are they doing? Please send photos! Cheers! Stan

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
Language students face multiple challenges, I would like to mention few of them.
Grammer rules are one of the biggest challenges, students often struggle with verb conjugations, and tenses, leading to confusion and mistakes.
Pronunciation is another major challenge when the listener and speaker are not forming same native language, it consumed much time to become fluent.
Learning new vocabulary is another challenge which most of the student face. Students need to remember a ton of new words which can be overwhelming. At the time of communication students struggle with stock of words they struggle to remember which words they must use to communicate properly.
Student‚Äôs speaking skills often lag reading and writing because real-time communication requires quick thinking, which can cause anxiety. While communicating with native speakers students might feel self-conscious or afraid of making mistakes their brain gets freeze, they won‚Äôt be able to think what to say next

activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Walking is one of the simplest and most effective forms of physical exercise. Unlike high-impact workouts or complex routines, walking requires no special equipment and can be done by people of nearly all ages and fitness levels. Engaging in a daily walk of just 30 minutes can bring a wide range of health benefits. It helps improve cardiovascular health by increasing heart rate and circulation, which in turn reduces the risk of heart disease and stroke. Additionally, walking can aid in weight management by burning calories and improving metabolism.

Beyond physical benefits, walking also has a positive impact on mental health. It has been shown to reduce stress, anxiety, and symptoms of depression. The act of walking‚Äîespecially outdoors in nature‚Äîcan clear the mind, boost mood, and enhance creativity. Moreover, daily walking fosters a sense of routine and discipline, making it easier to maintain a healthy lifestyle over time. Overall, it's a simple habit with profound effects.

activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
From: Lucas 
To : All
Josh,

We really have to make a decision about our business. Our landlord just wrote me another letter about the rent. Next month, it will be raised 25% to $4,500 per month. That's going to eat even more into our profits. I mean, Josh, that's $54,000 a year!

I'm going to summarize our discussions here. I know that you are strongly in favor of just staying where we are and paying the higher rent. The obvious disadvantages of that are that our sales of clothing are increasing more slowly than our expenses AND with the rapid growth in Centerville, we can expect further rent increases in the coming months. The big pro for staying is that we're in a fashionable district where long-term customers know us. We're right downtown, so customers can come in on their lunch breaks to be measured for a suit or other high-end clothing.

You know that I favor going to a completely different model. We move to the south end of town for making the clothes, but create a system where we meet people in their offices or schools to measure them for new clothes. We also open up a much better webpage than what we have now so that customers can view our clothing options and enter their measurements. Incredible cost savings! The con of that is that we lose the showroom, where customers can just come in and look at the possibilities, feel the cloth and talk to us about what would be appropriate for them. Far less personalized service, which has helped us build close relationships with our customers.

Honestly, I'd like another option, but I'm out of ideas. Should we talk to more people? I'm up for anything, but we really DO need to make a decision!

Thanks!

Ken

Thanks for the briefing. I‚Äôve researched a few outdoor team-building companies in Bangalore that meet your criteria‚Äîsafe, collaborative, and budget-friendly:

Xdog Trekking offers over 30 outdoor team-building activities designed to boost communication, trust, and problem-solving. Activities include ziplining, obstacle courses, and group challenges, all with a strong focus on safety and team spirit 1.

Thrillophilia provides a wide range of outdoor experiences like jungle survival, raft building, and blindfold tent pitching. They also partner with resorts like Guhantara and Shilhaandara for full-day outings, many of which are affordably priced and customizable for different comfort levels 2.

Outlife specializes in corporate team-building with a mix of outdoor and experiential learning activities. Their programs are designed to be inclusive, engaging, and aligned with team development goals 3.

Let me know if you'd like help comparing packages or booking a session.

Best,
EF Student

activity_instructions: Write a paragraph about how your friend stays healthy and in shape. Think of your topic sentence first. Then write other sentences to support the topic sentence examples. Think about questions like: **How often does he/she exercise? What does he/she eat?** Type in the input box. Write 25-50 words.
student_submission:
My friend has a very balanced lifestyle that contributes to his health and well-being. He starts the day with a morning routine that includes stretching and a light walk, which helps activate his body and mind for the day ahead. In addition, he maintains a healthy diet, prioritizing fresh, natural, and nutrient-rich foods such as fruits, vegetables, legumes, and lean proteins. He avoids processed foods and excessive sugars, preferring home-cooked meals with carefully selected ingredients. To stay properly hydrated, he drinks plenty of water throughout the day and limits sugary drinks and alcohol consumption. Another important habit is regular physical exercise; he goes to the gym three times a week, alternating between weight training and aerobic activities like running and cycling. This helps not only with physical conditioning but also cardiovascular health and stress management. Additionally, he values quality sleep, aiming to get about seven to eight hours per night, which is essential for body recovery and maintaining mental alertness. To take care of his mental health, he sets aside time to relax, meditate, or engage in hobbies he enjoys, such as reading books and listening to music. He also avoids sedentary behavior at work by standing up regularly to walk around or do small active breaks. Another important point is that he undergoes regular medical check-ups to monitor his overall health and prevent potential problems before they worsen. He also keeps an active social circle with friends and family, which contributes to his emotional balance and happiness. Finally, he is conscious about personal care, maintaining good hygiene and avoiding harmful habits like smoking or drug use. All these combined habits help my friend stay healthy both physically and mentally, living a full and energetic life.

If you want, I can help customize this text according to your friend's specific traits!

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
One of the most fascinating legendary creatures from Japan is the Kitsune, or fox spirit. Kitsune are intelligent foxes that possess magical abilities and are a staple of Japanese folklore. They are often depicted as shape-shifters, capable of taking on human form, typically that of a beautiful woman. This transformation ability is not merely a trick; it symbolizes the Kitsune's intelligence and cunning nature.

Kitsune are associated with the Shinto deity Inari, the god of rice, fertility, and prosperity, and are considered to be Inari's messengers. This connection imbues them with a dual nature: they can be both benevolent and malevolent. Benevolent Kitsune are known to protect and bring good fortune to those they encounter, often rewarding those who treat them with respect. Conversely, malevolent Kitsune might play tricks on humans, leading them astray or causing mischief.

A unique feature of the Kitsune is their multiple tails, which can range from one to nine. It is said that the more tails a Kitsune has, the older and more powerful it is. A nine-tailed Kitsune, or "Ky≈´bi no Kitsune," is particularly powerful and wise, embodying the pinnacle of Kitsune magic and mystique.

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
Learning a new language is an exciting but challenging journey. Many students face several difficulties along the way. One common problem is the fear of making mistakes. This fear often stops students from speaking in class or practicing with native speakers. How can learners overcome this fear? One solution is to create a supportive learning environment where mistakes are seen as a natural part of the learning process.

Another challenge is remembering vocabulary and grammar rules. Why do students forget new words easily? It often happens when they don't use the language regularly. To solve this, learners can practice daily by watching videos, reading articles, or chatting with friends in the target language.

Motivation is also a big issue. At first, students feel excited, but over time, they may lose interest. How can learners stay motivated? Setting small, achievable goals and celebrating progress can help. For example, learning five new words a day or having a short conversation once a week can build confidence.

Finally, exposure to the language outside the classroom is essential. Without real-life practice, it's hard to improve listening and speaking skills. Joining language exchange programs or using language apps can make a big difference.

In conclusion, while language learning has many challenges, with the right strategies and a positive attitude, students can succeed.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Hi Harry, Anne

Here are some tips to help you keep your employees motivated ‚Äî and a few things you should avoid as a leader.

**5 Ways to Motivate Your Team:**

1. **Recognize and reward good work.** When employees see that their efforts lead to rewards, they feel more engaged.
2. **Support their professional growth.** Show interest in their career development. Offer training, give feedback, and act as a mentor.
3. **Respect work-life balance.** Understand that employees also have personal lives. A healthy balance increases productivity.
4. **Listen to your team.** Giving people the chance to speak ‚Äî even when they‚Äôre frustrated ‚Äî helps build trust and motivation.
5. **Lead with respect.** Treat others the way you would like to be treated. A respectful workplace is a productive one.

**5 Ways to Demotivate Your Team:**

1. Disrespect employees just because they are below you.
2. Take credit for other people‚Äôs work.
3. Lose your temper easily.
4. Blame employees unfairly.
5. Forget to praise or thank them for a job well done.

Good luck with your leadership journey!

activity_instructions: Write a review of a restaurant where you have eaten recently. Talk about the food, the prices and anything else you think is important for people to know. Type in the input box. Write 60-100 words. This activity is non-graded.
student_submission:
Restaurant Review: Bella Italia Trattoria

Bella Italia Trattoria is a cozy, family-friendly Italian restaurant located in the heart of downtown. Known for its warm atmosphere and authentic flavors, it‚Äôs a great spot for both casual dinners and special occasions.

Food:
The menu offers a wide variety of traditional Italian dishes, including wood-fired pizzas, homemade pastas, and fresh seafood. Customer favorites include the creamy Fettuccine Alfredo, Margherita Pizza with a crispy thin crust, and the classic Tiramisu for dessert. Vegetarian and gluten-free options are also available.

Prices:
The prices are reasonable for the quality and portion sizes. Starters range from $8 to $12, main courses from $15 to $25, and desserts around $7. There‚Äôs also a lunch special menu with great value deals under $15.

Important to Know:

Opening hours: Open daily from 11:00 AM to 10:00 PM.

Reservations: Recommended on weekends, especially for dinner.

Service: Friendly and attentive staff; service is usually quick.

Payment: Accepts credit cards, debit cards, and digital wallets.

Extras: Outdoor seating available. Free Wi-Fi. Kid-friendly. Takeout and delivery services are also offered.

Whether you're looking for a romantic night out or a delicious family meal, Bella Italia Trattoria offers great food at fair prices with a welcoming ambiance.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Hi Harry,

Welcome to the team! It‚Äôs great to have you on board. Motivating your team effectively is key to achieving strong results and a positive work environment.

Firstly, listen to your team. Make time for regular one-on-one meetings to understand their strengths, goals, and concerns. Showing that you care builds trust. Set clear, realistic goals and recognize their efforts often‚Äîthis boosts morale and productivity. Encouraging teamwork and celebrating group success can also help build a supportive culture.

Offer opportunities for growth. Whether it‚Äôs training, new responsibilities, or mentoring, people stay motivated when they feel they are developing. Also, be open to feedback; it shows humility and helps you grow as a leader too.

As for what to avoid‚Äîdon‚Äôt micromanage. Give your team space to work and show trust in their abilities. Also, avoid being inconsistent with rules or communication, as this creates confusion and frustration.

With empathy, clarity, and support, you‚Äôll inspire your team to do their best. Good luck‚Äîyou‚Äôre going to do great!

Best regards,
[Jovana]
