From: Sandra
To: Josh, Ken

Josh and Ken,

I've been following your rent dilemma and have a third option that could work perfectly given Orlando's unique advantages.

What if you relocated to the new Creative Arts District on Colonial Drive? The city just announced a small business incentive program offering 18-month rent subsidies for fashion businesses that relocate there. You'd pay only $2,800/month initially, with gradual increases capped at 8% annually.

Here's the game-changer: Orlando's year-round convention traffic brings 75,000+ business travelers monthly who need last-minute tailoring services. The Creative District is perfectly positioned between the Convention Center and International Drive hotels. You could maintain your showroom for walk-ins while adding a premium "convention express" service ‚Äì same-day alterations and 48-hour custom fittings for traveling executives.

The district also has excellent parking, unlike downtown, and the city is installing shuttle connections to major hotels. Plus, three upscale restaurants are opening nearby, creating the perfect environment for your affluent clientele.

This hybrid model keeps your personalized service while tapping into Orlando's $7 billion tourism economy. The rent savings alone would offset any transition costs within six months.

Worth exploring?

Sandra

activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Technology has dramatically changed the world in which we live. From the invention of the wheel to the rise of the internet, every major technological advancement has shaped the way we interact with each other, the way we work, the way we live, and the way we think. In today‚Äôs digital age, the pace of technological development is faster than ever, and its impact on modern society is profound and far-reaching.

One of the most noticeable impacts of technology is on communication. Just a few decades ago, people relied heavily on letters, landline telephones, and face-to-face meetings to stay in touch. Today, with the proliferation of smartphones, social media, and instant messaging platforms, we are more connected than ever. People can talk to anyone, anywhere, at any time. This constant connectivity has created a global society where cultural exchange is common, and long-distance relationships‚Äîwhether personal or professional‚Äîare easier to maintain.

However, this convenience comes at a cost. While digital communication has made it easier to connect, it has also led to a decrease in the depth and quality of many interpersonal relationships. Face-to-face communication is being replaced by text messages and voice notes. Emotions can be misunderstood, and the lack of physical presence can lead to feelings of isolation. Social media platforms, though meant to bring people together, often cause anxiety, depression, and unrealistic comparisons.

activity_instructions: Your boss has asked you to write a formal report recommending a training company. You've chosen Skills Pro. Use your notes to write up the report. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
My Opinion on Corporate Social Responsibility

Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is no longer just a trend‚Äîit‚Äôs a necessity. In my opinion, businesses have a duty not only to their shareholders but also to society and the environment. Companies that invest in CSR show that they care about more than just profit, and this can build strong, lasting relationships with customers and communities.

Firstly, CSR helps create a positive public image. When companies support causes like environmental protection, education, or fair labor practices, people are more likely to support their brand. For example, when a company reduces its carbon footprint or donates to social programs, it gains respect and trust.

Secondly, CSR encourages long-term thinking. Instead of focusing only on short-term profits, responsible businesses consider how their actions affect future generations. This mindset can lead to more sustainable business practices and even innovation.

However, it‚Äôs important that CSR efforts are genuine. Some companies only use CSR as a marketing tool without making real changes. This can lead to public backlash if people feel they are being misled.

In conclusion, I believe CSR is essential in today‚Äôs world. When done sincerely, it benefits not only the company but also society as a whole. More businesses should view social responsibility as a core part of their mission‚Äînot just a side project.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
One legendary creature that fascinates me is the Curupira, a mythical being from Brazilian folklore. The Curupira is a small, red-haired forest guardian with a striking feature‚Äîhis feet are turned backwards. This unusual trait helps him confuse hunters and travelers by leaving footprints that lead in the opposite direction. The Curupira is known for his supernatural speed and piercing whistle, which can drive people mad or lead them astray deep into the forest.

He fiercely protects the Amazon rainforest and its creatures from harm, especially those who hunt animals unnecessarily or cut down trees without need. The Curupira can be both a trickster and a punisher‚Äîsometimes luring people into the woods as a warning or punishment. Despite his fearsome powers, he is respected and even admired by those who live close to nature.

This creature reflects Brazil‚Äôs cultural connection to the environment and the idea that nature itself fights back when disrespected. The Curupira is a powerful symbol of balance between humanity and the wild, blending fear, respect, and the mystery of the forest into one unforgettable figure.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Harry,
Here are some advices for motivating your employees:
- Incentivize your employees. A possible reward or voucher will motivate them.
- Listen to your employees. By listening to them, they will feel better, will work harder and will be more productive.
- Help your employees to progress and move up the ladder. Coaching and training are two ways to help them to progress and take new roles in the company.
- Have a good work-life balance. Make sure they take regular time off to recharge their batteries.
- Treat your subordinates the way you would like to be treated by your managers.

Here are things that demotivate your employees:
- Not recognize the work well done.
- Take ownership of the work done by your employees.
- Be angry and yell at them.
- Disrespect subordinates because they are below you.

Good luck with your team! EF student

Josh,

We really have to make a decision about our business. Our landlord just wrote me another letter about the rent. Next month, it will be raised 25% to $4,500 per month. That's going to eat even more into our profits. I mean, Josh, that's $54,000 a year!

I'm going to summarize our discussions here. I know that you are strongly in favor of just staying where we are and paying the higher rent. The obvious disadvantages of that are that our sales of clothing are increasing more slowly than our expenses AND with the rapid growth in Centerville, we can expect further rent increases in the coming months. The big pro for staying is that we're in a fashionable district where long-term customers know us. We're right downtown, so customers can come in on their lunch breaks to be measured for a suit or other high-end clothing.

You know that I favor going to a completely different model. We move to the south end of town for making the clothes, but create a system where we meet people in their offices or schools to measure them for new clothes. We also open up a much better webpage than what we have now so that customers can view our clothing options and enter their measurements. Incredible cost savings! The con of that is that we lose the showroom, where customers can just come in and look at the possibilities, feel the cloth and talk to us about what would be appropriate for them. Far less personalized service, which has helped us build close relationships with our customers.

Honestly, I'd like another option, but I'm out of ideas. Should we talk to more people? I'm up for anything, but we really DO need to make a decision!

Thanks!

Ken

I researched 3 options for team training and I will point out the strengths and weaknesses of each option.

The best option, in my opinion, is the Company "

This option is the cheapest and also the one that offers the greatest security because it is inside a coworking space. activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Hi Harry,

Welcome to your new role! I know that managing a team can be challenging, especially when it comes to keeping people motivated. So, I‚Äôd like to share a few ideas that might help you lead effectively.

First of all, it‚Äôs essential that employees feel the company‚Äôs success is also their own. When there‚Äôs a clear link between individual effort and collective results, motivation increases. Also, show genuine interest in each team member‚Äôs career path. Provide training opportunities and act as a mentor whenever possible.

Another key point is promoting a healthy work-life balance. Recognizing that everyone has responsibilities and interests outside of work shows empathy and builds commitment. Listen to your team carefully ‚Äì even when they‚Äôre venting. Just feeling heard can make a big difference.

On the other hand, avoid behaviors that demotivate, such as taking credit for others‚Äô work, raising your voice, or ignoring your team‚Äôs efforts. Small gestures of recognition and respect can have a huge impact on the working atmosphere.

Best of luck in this new chapter!
All the best.

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
My Opinion on Corporate Social Responsibility

I strongly believe that companies have a responsibility to society beyond just generating profits for shareholders. Businesses do not operate in a vacuum‚Äîthey rely on communities, natural resources, and human capital to thrive. Therefore, it is only fair that they give back and contribute positively to the environments in which they operate.

Corporate social responsibility (CSR) is not just a moral obligation; it‚Äôs also a smart business strategy. As Jack@MSU mentioned, consumers today are more conscious of the values behind the brands they support. A company with a strong CSR record can build trust, loyalty, and long-term customer relationships. This, in turn, leads to better financial performance.

Moreover, CSR initiatives such as fair employee treatment, environmental sustainability, and community engagement can improve employee morale and reduce turnover. When workers feel valued and see their company making a difference, they are more motivated and productive.

While some argue that CSR is just a marketing tool or that it should be the government‚Äôs job to regulate social good, I believe that companies have the resources and influence to lead by example. Waiting for regulations is reactive‚ÄîCSR is proactive.

In conclusion, companies should embrace their role as social actors. Profit and purpose are not mutually exclusive‚Äîthey can and should go hand in hand.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
One of the most fascinating legendary creatures in Indian mythology is the Naga, a serpent-like being that appears in Hindu, Buddhist, and Jain traditions. Nagas are depicted as either fully serpentine or as divine beings with human torsos and snake-like lower bodies. They are known to inhabit underground realms or sacred water bodies such as lakes and rivers, guarding hidden treasures and ancient wisdom.
Nagas are neither entirely benevolent nor wholly malevolent; some, like Shesha, serve as protectors and supporters of cosmic balance, while others, like Kaliya, are fierce and destructive. In Hindu mythology, Lord Vishnu is often depicted resting on the coils of the great Naga, Ananta-Shesha, signifying its cosmic importance.
These beings symbolize transformation, duality, and hidden power. Many temples, especially in South India, have Naga shrines where devotees pray for protection, fertility, and prosperity. The Naga legend continues to thrive, influencing folklore and spiritual practices across India.

student_submission:
CURRICULUM VITAE

I've laughed until my stomach hurt,
I've swam until I lost my breath,
I've cried until I fell asleep
And woke up with a disfigured face.
I've tickled my sister just to make her stop crying,
I've burned myself playing with a candle.
I've made gum balls and got mess all over my face.
I've talked to the mirror.
And I've even played at being a wizard.
I've wanted to be an astronaut,
A guitarist, a magician, a hunter and a trapeze artist.
I've hidden behind the curtain and left my feet outside,
I've made prank calls on the phone,
I've taken a shower in the rain,
And ended up getting addicted.
I've stolen a kiss,
I've confessed before going to sleep
In a dark room to my best friend.
I've confused feelings,
I've taken the wrong shortcut
And I keep walking through the unknown. I've scraped the bottom of the rice cooker,
I've cut myself shaving in a hurry,
I've cried listening to music on the bus.
I've tried to forget some people,
But I discovered that they are the hardest to forget.
I've climbed up on the roof to try to catch stars,
I've climbed a tree to steal fruit,
I've fallen down the stairs on my butt.
I've known death up close,
And now I long to live each day.
I've made eternal promises,
I've written on the school wall,
I've cried sitting on the bathroom floor,
I've run away from home forever,
And come back the next moment.
I've gone for a walk without a destination,
With nothing in my head, listening to stars.
I've run so as not to leave someone crying,
I've been alone in the middle of a thousand people,
Missing just one. I've seen pink and orange sunsets,
I've jumped into the pool with no desire to return,
I've drunk whiskey until my lips felt numb,
I've looked at the city from above
And still couldn't find my place.
I've felt afraid of the dark,
I've trembled with nerves,
I've almost died of love,
But I was reborn again to see the smile of someone
[special.
I've woken up in the middle of the night
And was afraid to get up.
I've bet on running barefoot in the street,
I've screamed with happiness,
I've stolen roses in a huge garden.
I've fallen in love and thought it was forever,
But it was always a "forever" in half.
I've laid down on the grass at dawn
And watched the Moon turn into the Sun,
I've cried when I saw friends leaving,
But I discovered that new ones soon arrive,
and life is really a coming and going without reason. So many things were done,
Moments photographed through the lens of emotion.
Kept in a trunk, called a heart.
And now a form questions me,
Pushes me against the wall and shouts:
"- What is your experience?".
This question echoes in my brain:
"experience... experience..."
Is being a "smile planter" a good
experience?
No!
"Maybe they don't know how to harvest dreams yet!"

student_submission:
O ChatGPT disse:
Claro! Aqui est√° um exemplo de um texto grande em ingl√™s sobre um tema geral (o impacto da tecnologia na sociedade). Se voc√™ quiser sobre outro assunto, √© s√≥ me avisar!

The Impact of Technology on Modern Society

Technology has become an inseparable part of modern life. From smartphones to artificial intelligence, the influence of technological advancements is evident in nearly every aspect of our daily routine. Over the past few decades, society has undergone rapid transformations driven by innovation, and these changes have brought both significant benefits and complex challenges.

One of the most notable impacts of technology is the way it has revolutionized communication. In the past, people relied on letters and landline phones to stay in touch. Today, social media platforms, video calls, and instant messaging apps allow individuals to communicate instantly across the globe. This global connectivity has made the world feel smaller and more interconnected, fostering cross-cultural understanding and collaboration.

In the field of education, technology has opened up new opportunities for learning. Online courses, digital textbooks, and virtual classrooms have made education more accessible than ever before. Students can now learn at their own pace, from virtually anywhere in the world. This has been particularly valuable during the COVID-19 pandemic, where remote learning became a necessity.

Healthcare has also been transformed by technological progress. Modern medical equipment, electronic health records, and telemedicine services have improved the quality of patient care and made medical services more efficient. In addition, advancements in biotechnology and pharmaceuticals have contributed to longer life expectancies and the treatment of previously incurable diseases.

However, the rise of technology is not without its downsides. Concerns about privacy, cybersecurity, and data misuse have become increasingly prominent. With more personal information being stored online, the risk of data breaches and identity theft has grown. Additionally, there are growing fears that automation and artificial intelligence may lead to widespread job displacement, particularly in industries reliant on repetitive tasks.

Moreover, the pervasive use of digital devices has raised questions about mental health and social isolation. While technology connects us digitally, it can sometimes disconnect us from the physical world and the people around us. Excessive screen time and reliance on virtual interactions may contribute to feelings of loneliness and anxiety.

In conclusion, technology continues to shape the way we live, work, and interact. Its positive contributions to society are undeniable, offering greater convenience, efficiency, and connectivity. However, it is essential to address the challenges it poses with thoughtful policies and ethical considerations. By doing so, we can ensure that technological progress benefits everyone and creates a more equitable and sustainable future.

activity_instructions: Your boss has asked you to write a formal report recommending a training company. You've chosen Skills Pro. Use your notes to write up the report. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Coca-Cola's greater popularity over Pepsi is due to a combination of historical factors, marketing strategies, and consumer perceptions. Coca-Cola has managed to establish a strong brand identity and a more extensive global presence than Pepsi, in addition to greater investment in advertising. Although Pepsi also has a strong presence and remains a major competitor, Coca-Cola has maintained an advantage in consumer preference. 
Below are some of the key factors:
1. History and Legacy:
Coca-Cola was created before Pepsi and has had more time to build its brand and establish itself as a market leader.
Coca-Cola's long history has contributed to its recognition and association with cultural moments and nostalgia.
2. Marketing Strategies:
Aggressive marketing:
Coca-Cola has invested heavily in advertising and promotion, generating greater brand recognition and association with happy moments and celebrations. 
Community Focus:
Coca-Cola has cultivated a brand image close to the community, emphasizing unity and happiness in its advertising campaigns. 
Adaptation to different markets:
While Coca-Cola has a global strategy, it has also proven to be adaptable to local preferences in different regions.

activity_instructions: Write a summary of a negotiation. It could be something you did at work, something you purchased on your own, or a summary of what happened in the movies in this unit. What was the preliminary offer? What happened during the negotiations? What was the final deal? Type in the input box. Write 100-150 words. This activity is non-graded.
student_submission: Last month, I negotiated the purchase of a used car from a private seller. The preliminary offer was $7,500 for a 2017 sedan with moderate mileage. During the negotiation, I pointed out a few issues: the tires were worn, and the car would soon need new brakes. I also mentioned that similar models were listed for slightly less in the area. The seller initially hesitated but eventually agreed to lower the price. We went back and forth a few times before settling on $6,800, with the seller agreeing to include a recent maintenance receipt and a full tank of gas. The final deal felt fair to both side. I got a reliable car at a better price, and the seller made a sale without needing to list the car for much longer. This experience taught me the value of respectful bargaining and being prepared with research.

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
How to Write an Engaging Blog Post

Writing a blog post can be a great way to share your ideas, experiences, and knowledge with others. To create an engaging post, start by choosing a clear topic that interests both you and your audience. Research your topic well to provide accurate and valuable information.

Next, plan your post by outlining the main points you want to cover. A well-structured post usually includes an introduction, body, and conclusion. The introduction should grab the reader‚Äôs attention and introduce the topic. In the body, develop your ideas with examples, facts, and explanations. Use short paragraphs and headings to make the text easy to read.

Don‚Äôt forget to write in a friendly and conversational tone to connect with your readers. After writing, proofread your post carefully to correct any mistakes and improve clarity. Finally, add relevant images or links to enhance the reader‚Äôs experience.

By following these steps, you can write blog posts that are informative, engaging, and enjoyable to read.

Hi Lucas,

I'm really sorry to hear that you're going through such a stressful time. I know how overwhelming school and personal problems can be, but please don‚Äôt try to deal with everything alone. Talking to someone ‚Äî whether it‚Äôs a friend, family member, or even a school counselor ‚Äî can help more than you think.

Try to take things one step at a time. Make a list of your responsibilities and organize them by priority. That way, you can focus on what‚Äôs most urgent and avoid feeling so overwhelmed. Also, don‚Äôt forget to take breaks and do something you enjoy, even if it‚Äôs just for a few minutes a day. Your mental health is just as important as your tasks.

If you ever feel like it‚Äôs too much, I really recommend seeking professional help. It‚Äôs a sign of strength, not weakness. You‚Äôre not alone, and I believe you‚Äôll get through this.

Your friend,

A Unique Law in India

India has some fascinating laws, and of the strictest is the ban on using a mobile phone while driving. If caught, drivers can face heavy fines, license suspension, or even jail time. This law was introduced to reduce accidents caused by distracted driving.

Another important regulation is the helmet law for motorcyclists.  In most states, riders must wear helmets at all times to ensure safety. This rule has helped reduce severe head injuries in road accidents.

These laws show how India prioritizes road safety. What do you think? Are they effective in preventing accidents?

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
People today are more socially conscious than ever, and buyers are prepared to pay more for sustainable products. Companies can report their efforts to buyers and other stakeholders by developing a CSR model. 
Corporate social responsability is a business model that encourage companies to preserve the environment; to be socially accountable to itself, its stakehders and the public. Companies are aware how they impact aspects of society and the how they need to enhance the environment.
The more visible and succesful a company is, the more responsibility it has to set standards of ethical behavior for its peers, competition, and industry.
According to a study published in the Wall Street Journal, consumers are more likely to act favorably toward a company that has acted to benefit its customers.
As a company engages in CSR, it is more likely to receive favorable brand recognition. Additionally, workers are more likely to stay with a company they believe in. This reduces employee turnover, disgruntled workers, and the total cost of a new employee.
CSR practices help companies mitigate risk by avoiding troubling situations. This includes preventing adverse activities such as discrimination against employee groups, disregard for natural resources, unethical use of company funds, and activity that leads to lawsuits, and litigation.

Formal Report: Recommendation for Staff Training Provider

After evaluating two training providers‚ÄîTrainQuick and Skills Pro‚Äîwe recommend selecting Skills Pro for our staff training program.

TrainQuick offers low-cost and flexible courses. However, feedback from our other branch indicates that uptake has been low. A significant concern is that employees dislike being grouped with participants from other branches, which affects engagement and satisfaction.

Skills Pro, while more expensive, has proven to deliver higher-quality training. Although some have described the course content as challenging, most participants successfully complete it, indicating that the difficulty level is appropriate and manageable. Furthermore, Skills Pro is planning to expand its course offerings, which could provide us with additional training options in the future.

In conclusion, despite the higher cost, we recommend Skills Pro. The quality and effectiveness of the training justify the investment, and it aligns better with our employees‚Äô preferences and our organizational goals.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Dear Harry,

Here are some suggestions for motivating your employees. I have added a few things that can be avoided.

Incentivize your employees by giving them a holiday voucher, allowing them to take some time off from their work.

Connect with them regularly to understand their career goals. Offer them additional training and act as their mentor.

Emphasize a healthy work-life balance. Recognize that employees have lives outside the company.

Listen to your employees. If people feel like they are being heard, even when they are complaining, they will be happier and more productive.

Here are five ways to demotivate your staff:

Disrespect subordinates because they are below you.

Take credit or claim responsibility for work done by your subordinates.

Lose your temper.

Let employees unfairly take the blame for things.

Don't compliment or praise people for good work.

I wish you the best for your team! 

EF student

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
My Opinion on Corporate Social Responsibility

Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is no longer just a trend; it has become a fundamental expectation in today‚Äôs business world. In my opinion, CSR plays a crucial role in shaping a company‚Äôs image, building customer trust, and contributing positively to society.

Firstly, companies that invest in social and environmental projects often gain a better reputation. Consumers are becoming more conscious of where they spend their money. For example, many people now prefer to buy from brands that support sustainability or social causes. This shift in consumer behavior shows that CSR can be a competitive advantage.

Secondly, CSR helps strengthen the relationship between businesses and local communities. Companies that support educational programs, healthcare initiatives, or environmental protection projects are seen as responsible and caring organizations. A good example is how some large supermarkets have reduced plastic use and promoted recycling, gaining public approval.

Lastly, CSR can increase employee satisfaction and motivation. People like to work for companies that share their values. When employees feel proud of their workplace, productivity and loyalty often increase.

In conclusion, CSR is not just about giving money to charity. It‚Äôs about making long-term, meaningful contributions to society while strengthening the company‚Äôs brand and internal culture. In my view, every company, regardless of size, should prioritize corporate social responsibility.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Hey Harry!
First of all, welcome to our team! We're all very excited to work with you.

About your concerns with motivating the staff, here are some strategies you might find effective to incentivize your subordinates:

- Listen to the members of your team. Talk to them to know that kind of problems they face in their daily routine and how can you help them to be more productive in their jobs.

- Emphasize work-life balance. We know that sometimes people reach high levels of stress and anxiety when they're feeling overwhelmed by the workload they have to deal with. It's really important to avoid burnout from happening to our employees.

- Get to know them. Try to learn what are their dreams and ambitions on a professional and even personal scope. As a leader, one of the crucial things to succeed is playing a role of mentor for those with less experience.

On top of that, we need to avoid some behaviors that could undermine the team morale. What you should not do on your managerial position?

- Disrespect anyone, especially in a scenario where you're acting poorly just because they're your subordinates.

- Lose your temper. Getting angry and yelling at people is absolutely unacceptable behavior.

- Take credit for others' work. In order to keep your team motivated, you have to give the due credit on everything they achieve and how good they perform.

Hope this tips can help you build a great professional relationship with your new subordinates.

Good luck!

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
For CSR
Companies have a big impact on society. They should help the communities where they operate. After all, those communities are letting them do business there. It's a two-way street. And it's the same with sustainable operations and fair employee benefits. The former secures future possibilities, and the latter ensures high productivity and low turnover.

The reason CSR makes good business sense, the reason it contributes to the bottom line, is because consumers care. Companies with a good CSR record are rewarded by customer loyalty. Consumers are happy, the company performs well and communities around the world benefit.

As an integrated part of society, corporations need to conform to social expectations, and that entails helping the community.

Against CSR
The problem with corporate social responsibility is that corporations don't have social responsibility. Milton Friedman has pointed out that the real responsibility of business is to increase its profits; business is not answerable to society's expectations but to the shareholders'.

It's great that corporations are spending huge sums of money on development projects across the world, but these sums of money are usually still inconsiderable relative to total earnings. In this sense, it's still quite a cheap marketing device to buy a good public image.

It's the government's job to make and enforce laws and regulations that will benefit the greater public. Corporations will need to conform to these regulations, but by no means should they be put in the driver's seat.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Dragons, one of the most iconic and revered mythical creatures, have captured the imagination of cultures around the world for centuries. These majestic beasts are often depicted as powerful, serpentine creatures with the ability to breathe fire, soar through the skies, and wield magical powers. They appear in varying forms, from benevolent guardians to fearsome adversaries, depending on the lore.
In Western mythology, dragons are often portrayed as malevolent beings, guarding treasures and challenging brave knights. The legendary dragon Fafnir, from Norse mythology, is famously known for his greed and transformation into a dragon to protect his hoard of gold.
Conversely, in Eastern mythology, dragons are celebrated as wise and benevolent beings that bring good fortune and prosperity. The Chinese dragon, or "Long," is a symbol of power, strength, and auspiciousness, often associated with the emperor and the natural elements.
The lore of dragons continues to thrive in modern culture, appearing in literature, film, and games, embodying the timeless allure of these magnificent beings.

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
The Challenges of 21st Century Youth and the Professions of the Future

Young people in the 21st century face a rapidly changing job market shaped by technology, automation, and globalization. Traditional careers are evolving, while new professions emerge, requiring constant adaptation and learning.
 
Education plays a crucial role in preparing youth for the future, but many institutions still follow outdated models. To succeed, young professionals must develop skills such as creativity, critical thinking, and digital literacy. Lifelong learning is essential, as industries transform and demand new expertise.

Despite uncertainties, the future offers opportunities for innovation and growth. Those who embrace change, seek knowledge, and cultivate adaptability will thrive in the evolving professional landscape.  


The Challenges Faced by 21st Century Youth in the Future Job Market

Young people in the 21st century face a rapidly evolving job market influenced by technology, automation, and globalization. Traditional careers are being transformed, while new professions emerge, requiring continuous learning and adaptation.

Education plays a crucial role in preparing youth for the future, but many institutions still follow outdated models. To succeed, young professionals must develop skills such as creativity, critical thinking, and digital literacy. Lifelong learning is essential, as industries constantly change and demand new expertise.

Despite uncertainties, the future offers opportunities for innovation and growth. Those who embrace change, seek knowledge, and cultivate adaptability will thrive in the evolving professional landscape.

We take full responsibility for this mistake and are already working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. The correct product will be shipped to you immediately at no additional cost. activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
One of the most captivating legendary creatures in Brazilian folklore is the Curupira. This elusive being is often depicted as a small, agile indigenous boy with fiery red hair and, most notably, backward-facing feet. This unique characteristic serves as a clever defense mechanism, as the Curupira leaves misleading footprints, confusing hunters and loggers who attempt to track him through the dense Amazon rainforest. 
The Curupira is known as the fierce guardian of the forests and its inhabitants. He uses his cunning and knowledge of the wilderness to protect the trees, plants, and animals from human exploitation and destruction. His methods can be mischievous, ranging from creating illusions and strange sounds to leading intruders astray, ensuring they get lost deep within the jungle. Tales of the Curupira serve as a powerful reminder of the importance of respecting nature and its delicate balance, embodying the spirit of environmental protection within Brazilian culture.

activity_instructions: Read an email from your friend and give advice on some stressful problems he is having. Type in the input box. Write 100-200 words.

Hi Leon,

I'm really sorry to hear that you're going through such a tough time. It sounds like you have a lot on your plate, and it's understandable to feel overwhelmed. For work, it might be helpful to have an open conversation with your manager about your concerns. Sometimes, expressing how you feel can lead to positive changes or at least offer a bit of relief. If things don't improve, consider exploring other opportunities that align better with your values and goals.

Regarding your relationship with Tia, it's important to communicate openly and honestly about what isn't working. Relationships can be complicated, and sometimes they don't go the way we hope. If you decide to end things, give yourself time to heal and reflect.

Above all, make sure to prioritize your well-being. Engage in activities that you enjoy and that help you relax, whether it's exercise, meditation, or spending time with friends. Remember, it's okay to ask for help, whether from friends or professionals.

I'm here for you anytime you need to talk.

activity_instructions: An old friend has emailed you, describing what he's been doing for the last decade. Pretend you have two kids living abroad, and write a response describing what they have been doing. Type in the input box. Write 50-100 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
Hey! I got your email address from our old friend, Valerie. I can't believe that we've only seen each other once in the last 20 years! A lot has happened in my life since then.

About five years ago, Stella and I moved with our son Jeremy to Oxford, New Zealand, and lived out in the country. I did contract design work. You know that's what I've always loved. Stella taught math in a local university. Jeremy went to school and made a lot of friends. Eventually, though, we ended up back in St. Louis, where we've been living for the past year.

I'm working for a design firm, and Stella has been teaching in a university. We bought a little two-bedroom house in the suburbs, and we're basically happy, but sometimes we feel that something's missing. The suburbs are crowded, and the houses all look the same. Jeremy left for college, so we're lonely, old empty nesters looking for a change. We're actually thinking about adopting a child. At our age, are we crazy?

Anyway, let's reconnect. Your kids must be all grown up now. How are they doing? Please send photos!

Cheers!

Stan

activity_instructions: Write a summary of a negotiation. It could be something you did at work, something you purchased on your own, or a summary of what happened in the movies in this unit. What was the preliminary offer? What happened during the negotiations? What was the final deal? Type in the input box. Write 100-150 words. This activity is non-graded.
student_submission: I recently negotiated the price of a used car I purchased from a private seller. The preliminary offer was $8,000 for a 2015 Honda Civic. After researching comparable vehicles and identifying some minor cosmetic issues during the test drive, I brought up the concerns and used them as leverage to negotiate. The seller initially stood firm but eventually agreed that the repairs would cost money. I also mentioned that I was ready to pay in cash and could close the deal immediately. After about 20 minutes of back-and-forth, we settled on a final price of $7,300. The negotiation remained respectful and focused on facts, which helped both parties feel satisfied with the outcome.

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
Companies Have a Responsibility to Society

In today‚Äôs world, businesses have a powerful role that goes beyond generating profit. I strongly believe that companies have a responsibility to society, not just to their shareholders. Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is no longer a luxury or a marketing tool‚Äîit‚Äôs a necessity.

Companies operate within communities, use natural resources, and benefit from public infrastructure and education. As such, they should give back to the very systems that support them. For example, tech companies can support digital education in underserved areas, while manufacturing firms can reduce emissions and ensure ethical labor practices. These actions not only create a positive impact but also build long-term trust with consumers.

Opponents may argue that a company‚Äôs main duty is to its shareholders. However, ignoring social and environmental responsibilities can backfire. Negative publicity, boycotts, or legal action due to unethical practices can hurt a company‚Äôs reputation and profits. On the other hand, being socially responsible attracts customers, talent, and investors who care about values and sustainability.

In conclusion, companies should not operate in isolation from the society they benefit from. Social responsibility isn‚Äôt just good ethics‚Äîit‚Äôs good business. The world today needs organizations that care not only about what they produce but also about the impact they¬†leave¬†behind.

activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Josh,

We really have to make a decision about our business. Our landlord just wrote me another letter about the rent. Next month, it will be raised 25% to $4,500 per month. That's going to eat even more into our profits. I mean, Josh, that's $54,000 a year!

I'm going to summarize our discussions here. I know that you are strongly in favor of just staying where we are and paying the higher rent. The obvious disadvantages of that are that our sales of clothing are increasing more slowly than our expenses AND with the rapid growth in Centerville, we can expect further rent increases in the coming months. The big pro for staying is that we're in a fashionable district where long-term customers know us. We're right downtown, so customers can come in on their lunch breaks to be measured for a suit or other high-end clothing.

You know that I favor going to a completely different model. We move to the south end of town for making the clothes, but create a system where we meet people in their offices or schools to measure them for new clothes. We also open up a much better webpage than what we have now so that customers can view our c
lothing options and enter their measurements. Incredible cost savings! The con of that is that we lose the showroom, where customers can just come in and look at the possibilities, feel the cloth and talk to us about what would be appropriate for them. Far less personalized service, which has helped us build close relationships with our customers.

Honestly, I'd like another option, but I'm out of ideas. Should we talk to more people? I'm up for anything, but we really DO need to make a decision!

Thanks!

Ken

student_submission:
Daily exercise is essential for maintaining a healthy body and mind. It helps improve physical fitness, strengthens muscles, and supports cardiovascular health. In addition to physical benefits, regular activity also boosts mental well-being by reducing stress, anxiety, and symptoms of depression. People who exercise regularly often experience better sleep and increased energy throughout the day.

Exercise does not have to be intense or time-consuming. Even simple activities like walking, stretching, or riding a bicycle can make a significant difference. The key is consistency. Making physical activity part of your daily routine, even for just 30 minutes a day, can lead to long-term health improvements.

Moreover, exercising with friends or family can make the experience more enjoyable and help build strong social connections. In a world where many people spend hours sitting at desks or looking at screens, staying active is more important than ever. Your body and mind will thank you.

student_submission:
Corporate social responsibility (CSR) is at the heart of a long-standing debate: should companies serve society at large, or focus solely on delivering returns to shareholders? On one side, proponents argue that businesses, as embedded parts of communities, must "give back"‚Äîthrough fair treatment of workers, investment in the environment, and support for local development. This perspective holds that socially responsible behavior fosters long-term benefits like employee retention, customer loyalty, and brand trust‚Äîa virtuous cycle that ultimately enhances financial performance

Empirical evidence supports this. Millennials and Gen Z‚Äîwho now comprise a massive portion of the workforce‚Äîare increasingly drawn to employers with strong CSR commitments. Research shows up to 85‚ÄØ% value environmental initiatives, with 75‚ÄØ% willing to change purchasing habits based on corporate values . Moreover, MIT Sloan advocates reframing CSR as "stakeholder value"‚Äîbalancing needs of employees, customers, and communities alongside those of investors . On the opposing side, classic shareholder theory‚Äîchampioned by Milton Friedman‚Äîasserts that a corporation's only social responsibility is to its owners: ‚Äúto increase its profits‚Ä¶ so long as it stays within the rules of the game‚Äù Friedman argued that social goals should be pursued by individuals or governments,

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
Whispers of the Sunset

As the sun begins its gentle descent,
A dance of colors, soft and bent.
The sky, once bright, now wears a crown
Of amber, rose, and deep twilight brown.
Each cloud, a brushstroke in the sky,
A fleeting masterpiece passing by.

The golden hour kisses the earth,
A reminder of the day's rebirth.
The winds, they whisper, soft and low,
Telling secrets only night would know.
With every step, the shadows grow,
As day surrenders to the afterglow.

In the distance, mountains stand,
Like silent guardians of the land.
Their peaks kissed by the fading light,
They whisper stories of the night.
The stars begin to pierce the dark,
Each one a story, a silent spark.

The world exhales, the quiet spreads,
As daylight slowly turns to threads.
A final burst of crimson red,
Before the sun lies down its head.
And in that moment, all is still,
The sky, the earth, the moon, the hill.

A peace that lingers, soft and deep,
For in the sunset's arms, we sleep.
Dreaming of the stars above,
Cradled by the quiet love
Of twilight's endless, tender grace,
As night takes time to find its place.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
One of the most popular legendary creatures in India is the Naga, a serpent deity revered in Hindu and Buddhist traditions. Nagas are often depicted as half-human, half-serpent beings, possessing immense power and wisdom. They are believed to reside in the underworld, known as Patala, and are guardians of treasures and water bodies.

Nagas are considered both benevolent and malevolent. They can bring rain and fertility, ensuring the prosperity of the land, but they can also cause droughts and floods if angered. The most famous Naga is Shesha, the king of all Nagas, who serves as the bed for Lord Vishnu, one of the principal deities in Hinduism. Shesha is depicted with multiple heads, each symbolizing his vast knowledge and power.

In various myths, Nagas interact with humans, sometimes marrying them or bestowing blessings upon them. They are also associated with the protection of sacred texts and temples. The reverence for Nagas is evident in many festivals and rituals across India, where people offer prayers and milk to snake idols, seeking their favor and protection. This deep-rooted belief in Nagas highlights their significance in Indian culture and mythology.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
The Phoenix is a legendary creature that has captivated human imagination for centuries. Originating from ancient Greek mythology, the Phoenix is often depicted as a magnificent bird with vibrant plumage, typically in fiery hues of red, gold, and purple. This mythical bird is renowned for its unique life cycle: it is said to live for several hundred years before it builds a nest of aromatic wood, sets it ablaze, and is consumed by the flames. From the ashes, a new Phoenix arises, symbolizing rebirth, renewal, and the eternal cycle of life.

The Phoenix's story has been embraced by various cultures, each adding their own nuances to the legend. In Egyptian mythology, the Bennu bird shares similarities with the Phoenix, representing the sun, creation, and resurrection. In Chinese culture, the Fenghuang is a mythical bird that embodies the balance of yin and yang, often associated with the Empress and symbolizing virtue and grace.

The Phoenix's enduring legacy lies in its powerful symbolism. It serves as a metaphor for overcoming adversity, rising from the ashes of despair, and emerging stronger and more resilient. This timeless legend continues to inspire and resonate with people around the world, reminding us of the potential for renewal and transformation within us all.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that‚Äö√Ñ√¥s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
In Spanish folklore, gamusinos are legendary creatures said to inhabit remote forests, mountains, and rural areas. Descriptions of gamusinos vary widely, as they are intentionally vague and elusive‚Äîsome say they are small, furry animals with glowing eyes, while others claim they are invisible or shape-shifting beings. What unites all versions is that no one has ever truly seen one, making them a perfect subject for playful storytelling.

The legend of the gamusino has spread across Spain through oral tradition and rural humor. A common joke involves sending unsuspecting city folk or children on a ‚Äúgamusino hunt,‚Äù fully aware that the creature doesn‚Äôt exist. This harmless prank became a cherished tradition, especially in summer camps and scout groups, where it fostered bonding and sparked creativity.

Over time, the gamusino has become a symbol of whimsical folklore and the power of collective storytelling. Its expansion across Spain reflects not just regional creativity, but also a shared cultural love for mystery, humor, and the joy of believing in the unbelievable.

The creature‚Äôs name varies by region: mush in Extremadura, gambusino in Andalusia, gambozin in Portugal, and donyet, gambosi, or gambutzi in Catalonia and Valencia‚Äîwhere it refers to a ‚Äúdwarf so tiny it‚Äôs barely visible.‚Äù Even the Royal Spanish Academy (RAE) acknowledges the gamusino, defining it as an ‚Äúimaginary animal, whose name is used to trick learner hunters.‚Äù

activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Proposal for Building a Community Green Hub in Sunridge City

Sunridge City, known for its sunny weather and rapidly growing population of 500,000, has recently faced rising concerns about urban pollution and a lack of accessible green spaces. Over 60% of residents live in apartment complexes with limited access to parks or community gardens. Our latest city health report revealed that only 18% of children meet the daily physical activity recommendations, while adult stress levels have increased by 30% in the past two years.

To address these challenges, I propose the development of a Community Green Hub in the heart of Sunridge. This space would include a public garden, walking paths, shaded sitting areas, and a small outdoor stage for local performances and health workshops. Studies from similar cities show that access to green spaces improves mental well-being, promotes physical activity, and fosters stronger community ties.

With the support of city funding and volunteer efforts, the Green Hub can become a vibrant, healthy space where families, students, and seniors come together to grow, learn, and thrive.

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
Language learning is a rewarding yet challenging endeavor. Students often face several issues and challenges during their journey.

What are the common difficulties in language learning? One major challenge is vocabulary acquisition. Memorizing new words and their meanings can be daunting, especially when they don't have direct translations in the learner's native language. Pronunciation is another hurdle; mastering the sounds and intonations of a new language requires consistent practice and often, guidance from native speakers.

How do cultural differences impact language learning? Cultural nuances and idiomatic expressions can be perplexing. Understanding the context in which certain phrases are used is crucial for effective communication. For instance, humor and sarcasm can be particularly tricky to grasp and use appropriately.

What role does motivation play? Maintaining motivation over time is essential but challenging. Initial enthusiasm can wane, especially when progress seems slow. Setting realistic goals and celebrating small victories can help sustain motivation.

How does the learning environment affect progress? A supportive learning environment is vital. Access to resources like language apps, books, and conversation partners can significantly enhance the learning experience. Conversely, a lack of such resources can hinder progress.

What strategies can help overcome these challenges? Consistent practice, exposure to the language through media, and engaging with native speakers are effective strategies. Joining language learning communities can provide support and encouragement.

In conclusion, while language learning presents various challenges, understanding and addressing these issues can lead to a more successful and enjoyable learning experience. What specific challenges have you faced in your language learning journey?

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
While the primary objective of any business is to generate profit, I strongly believe that companies also have a broader responsibility to society. This view doesn‚Äôt oppose capitalism; rather, it aligns with a more sustainable and ethical version of it.

Companies do not operate in a vacuum. They use public infrastructure, benefit from educated workforces, and rely on stable communities to succeed. With this access comes a duty‚Äînot just to shareholders, but also to stakeholders: employees, customers, communities, and the environment.

Corporate social responsibility (CSR) is not only morally right‚Äîit‚Äôs also smart business. A growing number of consumers actively support ethical companies, and employees are more loyal to companies that treat them and their communities well. In the long run, CSR can drive innovation, reduce risk, and build brand strength.

That said, CSR should not be used as a hollow marketing tactic. True responsibility means making real changes: fair labor practices, environmentally sustainable operations, and active community support‚Äînot just occasional donations or one-off initiatives.

In conclusion, companies must pursue profits responsibly. They have the power‚Äîand therefore the responsibility‚Äîto contribute positively to the society that enables their success. Profit and purpose are not mutually exclusive‚Äîthey are partners in long-term, sustainable success. - Alcocer@1980

Life moves quickly, often sweeping us up in a whirlwind of obligations, routines, and expectations. In the midst of it all, it‚Äôs easy to overlook the small, beautiful moments that quietly enrich our lives‚Äîa deep breath in the morning, laughter shared with a loved one, the calm of the sky at sunset. These seemingly insignificant experiences are often the ones that ground us, bring us peace, and remind us of what truly matters.

When we slow down, even briefly, we create space to reconnect‚Äîwith ourselves, with others, and with the present moment. Gratitude grows in that stillness. And from gratitude comes joy‚Äînot the fleeting joy of achievement, but the lasting joy of being. By noticing and appreciating life‚Äôs little blessings, we discover that fulfillment doesn‚Äôt always come from doing more or having more. Sometimes, it‚Äôs simply about being present and embracing what is already here.

activity_instructions: You're going to reply to Alice's blog post about cross-cultural communication. Give advice about your own culture. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
The Journey of a Dreamer

It was a bright and chilly morning when Jack stood by the window, gazing out at the sprawling city. The world seemed so vast and full of opportunities, yet he couldn't shake off the feeling that something was missing. For years, he had followed the path laid out for him: finish school, get a stable job, and live a comfortable life. But inside, Jack always felt like there was more to life than just playing it safe.

Every day, he passed by the same familiar streets, and yet he couldn't help but wonder what lay beyond them. He had dreams‚Äîbig dreams‚Äîbut they always seemed out of reach. His heart longed for adventure, for the kind of freedom that comes with stepping into the unknown. Jack knew he had to make a choice: continue living a life of routine or take a leap of faith and pursue the dream that had always burned within him.

One afternoon, Jack made the decision. He packed his things, said goodbye to his old job, and boarded a flight to a faraway land. It wasn‚Äôt the easiest decision he had ever made. There were doubts, fears, and endless what-ifs running through his mind. But deep down, he knew that this was the only way to truly live.

His first stop was a small coastal village in Portugal. The moment Jack arrived, the scent of the sea and the sound of crashing waves immediately put him at ease. He felt like he was in the right place. In the city, he had been just another face in the crowd, but here, he was a stranger in a new world, and that felt both humbling and exciting.

Jack spent his days exploring the narrow, cobblestone streets, meeting new people, and learning about the culture. He discovered that life in the village was simple but beautiful. The locals were warm and welcoming, always eager to share their stories. Every evening, Jack would sit at a local caf√©, sipping coffee as the sun dipped below the horizon, casting a golden glow over the sea. It was in these moments that he felt alive, truly alive in a way he hadn‚Äôt in years.

As the weeks passed, Jack began to understand something important: his dreams were not about grand accomplishments or fame. They were about living authentically, experiencing life without the constraints of fear or societal expectations. In the village, he found not only peace but also clarity.

One evening, as Jack walked along the beach, he met an old fisherman named Miguel. The man had a weathered face and hands rough from years of work, but his eyes were kind and full of wisdom. They struck up a conversation, and soon, Jack found himself listening to Miguel‚Äôs life story. The fisherman had spent most of his years out on the sea, learning the ways of the ocean, the winds, and the tides. But it wasn‚Äôt just the sea that taught Miguel lessons. It was the quiet moments, the long hours of solitude, and the simplicity of life that had given him the most valuable lessons.

"Sometimes," Miguel said, "we think that we have to follow a certain path. We believe that the future is something we can control. But in reality, life has a way of guiding us where we need to go, even when we don‚Äôt know it ourselves."

Jack thought about this for a long time. It wasn‚Äôt about having everything figured out. It was about trusting the journey and embracing the unknown. Over the next few months, Jack learned to let go of the need for control. He stopped worrying about what he should be doing or where he was supposed to be. Instead, he followed his heart, trusting that the right opportunities would come at the right time.

By the time Jack returned to the city, he was a changed man. He no longer felt the pressure to live up to other people‚Äôs expectations. He had realized that the greatest adventure of all was the journey of self-discovery. Jack began to pursue his passions‚Äîphotography, writing, and traveling‚Äîand soon found that the world had more to offer than he had ever imagined.

In the end, Jack‚Äôs journey wasn‚Äôt just about the places he visited or the people he met. It was about the person he became along the way. He had learned to embrace uncertainty, to trust in the beauty of the unknown, and to live with purpose. And that, he realized, was the greatest dream of all.

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
My take on CSR
By Vale322 at 17:25, today

CSR, or corporate social responsibility, has been a big topic of discussion in recent years. It refers to companies taking responsibility for the impact their actions have upon their workforce, their community and the world ‚Äì which, for me, should be an essential part of any operating business.

As an integral part of society, corporations should help the communities where they operate. By sponsoring improvements in local education, the company is actually cultivating its future workforce. And on a global scale, operating sustainably helps ensure that all businesses have adequate resources to operate in the future. As members of the local community, businesses should support community development by sponsoring local projects and donations. A company should also to pay even its lowest employees a livable salary and make sure they work in a hazard-free office. 
In addition,  companies with a good CSR record are rewarded by customer loyalty. Consumers are happy, the company performs well and communities around the world benefit.

Some critics believe CSR is just a publicity stunt, nothing more than a marketing device to manipulate public perception. While it may be true that a company needs to maintain its public image, and CSR is a good method of doing that, we must not ignore the fact that this oftentimes is a win-win situation. If a company ensures fair benefits for its staff, it usually enjoys less turnover and higher productivity.

To sum up, I believe CSR should be an innate part of business operations. Consistent adherence to corporate social responsibility principles can help the company and its shareholders, as well as people in need in the local community and around the world.

Second, as remote work continues, maintaining team communication may become more difficult. Implementing regular virtual check-ins and using collaboration tools more effectively could help keep everyone aligned.

Let me know what you think. I¬¥m happy to discuss these ideas further.

Best regards,

Jhon Borray

Good afternoon. I am deeply concerned about the functionality of the automation tool for telephony testing. activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission: Reading regularly is one of the most beneficial habits a person can develop. Not only does it enhance vocabulary and improve language skills, but it also stimulates mental faculties and nurtures creativity. When someone reads, they are exposed to new perspectives, cultures, and ideas, broadening their understanding of the world. Reading fiction, for example, fosters empathy by allowing readers to experience the emotions and struggles of characters very different from themselves. On the other hand, nonfiction books provide valuable knowledge and practical information that can be applied in daily life or professional contexts. Additionally, reading can be a powerful stress-reliever. Studies have shown that even a few minutes of reading can significantly reduce stress levels and promote relaxation. Whether it‚Äôs a novel, a biography, a scientific article, or even poetry, regular reading develops critical thinking, concentration, and emotional intelligence. In a world increasingly dominated by screens and fast content, making time to read deeply is more important than ever.
